  9. I read many of the reviews and I decided to give this trimmer a try. The comb rusted after the first use and the comb teeth width is too small. Because the teeth on the comb are too small for facial hair it misses a lot of the hair and you have to go over your face many times. I bought this as a back up because my other trimmer is dying but I didn't make it through an entire shave before switching to my old trimmer that has wider teeth. Packaged up and is headed back.

  13. Bit of a plastic feel but works well. Much cheaper than the prices available here in Australia. I'm very happy with it

  15. I almost didn't buy this trimmer because of the large number of negative reviews, but took a shot anyway based on the good reviews. I cant speak about how long it will last, but I am very happy with it, so far. My last trimmer was much more expensive and didn't do nearly as good a job. I only needed one of the guides for my beard, so I have all the others I don't need. It is a bit loud, but not unbearable. The ear trimmer actually works, and so does the shaving head. Some people mentioned that the bare trimmer will bite you, and it will, so be careful. The only problem I have is the heads are a bit difficult to attach, but once you figure it out, its fine. I definitely recommend this trimmer.
  16. I got this item because it was an all in one and the reviews on it were overall good. While I haven't been able to try out all the attachments that come with since my beard isn't long enough I will not grade those items. I've used the default blade that comes per-attached and it works wonderfully however the so called smooth shaver attachment is just abysmal. Not only does it take forever to shave due to the small head size but it doesn't do that good of a job at shaving(doesn't get very close unless you really PUSH it into your face). If I could I could return this set I would.
  17. I have had Wahl products in the past with good results. This time I messed up.To many accessories! A better design could keep it more simple<br />Standard Wahl narrow blade head not as good for faster trims.

  19. I'm leaning towards 5 stars as I am very happy with this. The only things I would say is that it is mainly made out of plastic (except for the blades of course) which gives it kind of a cheap feel however it does work great. The handle part has a rubbery cover which tends to collect clippings on it as well. The stand it good but it does not really hold the charging cable so really you have to plug the cable in while the trimmer is out of the stand and then set it in after. It is not really a charging stand. It holds a charge for an amazingly long time so this is not really that inconvenient. I was surpised with the number of usefull attachments that this comes with.<br /><br />Overall a great value for what I paid - $24.95
  20. Got mine from Target and had it about 2 years. It saw use maybe once a month for 20 minutes and it's done dead on me. I've only ever charged it right before use and now the thing is useless. Wahl has a warranty for 5 years but why bother when you have to pay to ship it. I can get a new one from another brand for just a little bit more and no hassle or waiting. It was okay while it lasted, but for the amount I used it, it should have lasted a lot longer.

  24. I've had a rechargeable trimmer for a couple of years that was doing a good job, but I was noticing the recharge life was getting shorter and shorter, then the charger died. I've known the Wahl name for many years because my barbers have used them. I figured if it's good enough for professionals, it's good enough for me to try out. Then I realized it was also Lithium Ion! That should help! The first thing I noticed after unpacking is the poorly designed holder for all the head accessories. It's not very good at doing what it's supposed to do, but that has nothing to do with the function. It was already charged, so I gave it a try. WOW! This is a much better trimmer that I've ever had! It just feels solid, and sounds sharp as it cuts. The heads interchange perfectly, once you get the hang of it, and feel very solid. I have been extremely happy with this Wahl trimmer, and to top it off, it is Made In America by U.S. workers! I couldn't be happier, unless they redesigned that storage tray and sent me one!
  25. Replaces another that lived only four years, but at least I now have two sets of attachments. Wahl blades do seem to remain sharp longer than those of other trimmers, and at the relatively low cost of this trimmer, replacement every few years is annoying but acceptable.

  29. I've had this a few months, and use it every day. All the accessories are nicely made, the unit lasts forever between charges, and the cutting blades seems to work very well...<br /><br />My only complaint, albeit minor, is that I use it to trim existing stubble... and the cutter with NO guard on it cuts very close, and the smallest guard leaves more stubble than I would like. This is quite minor... and more of a piece of information than a complaint. My old trimmer, with no guard, did not cut as close... so I was used to that setting. This one, without the guard, cuts even closer... which is what it's supposed to do... and the smallest guard still leaves stubble a bit long, imo. But no biggie... great unit, great design, good feel in the hand, and lasts a long time between charges.

  41. I am getting ready to buy this trimmer for the third time. The first time I left it in a hotel and the second one I misplaced the blade attachments. I really like the results I am able to achieve with this trimmer. Whether I have a full beard or switch it up with a goatee, this trimmer allows me to groom and style any way I want. Some of the other reviewers have talked about the noise but I haven't found it to be a problem. Its a clipper and its not going to be whisper quiet.<br /><br />I am aware that these devices are designed to be disposable and after about a year or so I found the blades to get a little dull. I have no idea if these can be sharpened. But for 30 bucks I find it to be an outstanding value and have no problems justifying its purchase. My barber charges 10 bucks for lineups and trims in between full blown haircuts so this allows me to skip the weekly trips to the barbershop. Depending on the look I am trying to keep I can almost go a month without a trip to the barber.<br /><br />The charge lasts a while....it lasts so long that when it dies I cant remember when it was last charged up. Then I just charge it and its always fully charged when I come home.<br /><br />Other reviewers mentioned the stand and they are right..its not convenient nor have I found a way to make all of the attachments fit securely although there is a diagram in the manual on how to do so...<br /><br />In conclusion this is a great buy for the money and Amazon had the lowest price..Local drugstores and Target had this for 39.99.

  45. I like this trimmer. It's the second one I've bought and it failed, just like the first one, after about six months use. I'm also going to take mine apart and clean and protect the internals from corrosion, which is a silly thing to have to do. Maybe instead of a flimsy plastic tray filled with junk accessories they could have spent the money to make a more solid product.
  46. REVIEW UPDATE: After using this trimmer for several months I have discovered what I consider a major flaw in design after I wrote this review. The cutting blades are not rust proof. I got mine wet and the next day they had a major rust issue. I would not given this 5 stars originally if I new that this would happen<br /><br />I love the power of the razor and the lithium battery provides for weeks of daily use without recharging. I almost gave it 4 stars because the attachments are tricky to change. Once you get the hang of changing them it is not too bad, but I almost broke some of them by forcing the issue when I first got it. I mostly use it without the attachments so that is not a big deal to me. If you switch attachments I would look for a different product.
  47. Rusted after a few months!
  48. The other reviews are right, I'm glad I trusted them. This trimmer works very well, especially compared to the Conair 13-piece that I had before this. It's great that it charges so quickly and keeps its charge for so long.
  49. Easily the best and most powerful I've used.. And I've used more than a few. I actually bought this one to replace the wife's trimmer. After examining it, I confiscated it and gave her my Remington which is weak and a poor cutter by comparison. LOL I agree, like most trimmers of this sort it's not a hair cutter. It's a hair trimmer. Meaning it's just not designed to give full service haircuts. But will do in a pinch. For trimming between haircuts, body hair management, beards, etc.. it's hard to beat. Lithium ion is definitely the way to go. The blades are incredibly precise and are reminiscent of a bygone era. They are carbon steel, so they aren't rinsable and must be oiled occasionally. But the extra performance and longevity of the ground carbon blades are a big plus, especially for a tool of this type. The attachments and stand work very well and are well designed. There is a slight learning curve if you've never used a Wahl before. And no travel case or blade protector is included. The nose/ear/eyebrow attachment works very well and like the other blades is a very precise cutter. Especially compared to other rotary versions on the market, like the Remington. It's made for outlining the brow and removing stray hairs, not trimming the entire eyebrow. If you wish to do this, just use the #00 or the #000 beard attachment guide and the regular blade.
  50. The Lithium Ion is great!! This is your mans friend!!
  51. After owning this Wahl Lithium Ion facial hair trimmer for 2 weeks one of the blades began making a high pitched buzzing noise. I took the blade apart to see what was going on and the 2 pronged wire that connects the blade to the power supply had broken in half. After a few more months the other blade also broke the same exact way. The battery lasted a while but the overall quality was crap. I threw it in the trash can and will not buy another Wahl product again.
  52. [[VIDEOID:mo2L8X0JEQZWSNN]]I purchased this unit in August 2009 and it broke after about 5 uses. Watch my review to see the cheap construction inside. The battery does run for a long time but thats not what I got it for. All i wanted was a stubble trim! Update (March 2010): Received a partial refund, that moves it up from 1 star to 2.
  53. Charges very quickly but it has a odd bug. If it runs out of charge and you charge it back up it will not turn back on till you plug it in while the device is turned on then let it charge for a second or two then turn it off unplug and then it will turn on again. i am taking away a half star for that and a half star for not being as close as other shavers. Still a great shaver none the less.
  54. I have been using this once each week to reduce my beard back down to stubble per my wife's wishes, so I only use the #1 attachment and cannot speak to the others. I bought it because my Norelco vacuum rechargeable was failing to hold a charge. I charged this one the first time and did not have to charge it again for 9 months. I was surprised at how long it lasted and it kept good power right up until the end. It is now a year since purchase and I am only on my second recharge. It cuts better than the Norelco because it has more power. It is narrower, but that is not a problem. The ergonomics are very good --it is comfortable, compact, and light. The handle is a magnet for beard clippings, but a quick swipe with a damp sponge will clean it adequately. The plastic holding tray is not exciting, but I don't expect to decorate the bath with my trimmer -- it goes in a drawer in a cabinet. It does not have a vacuum, but I found that the vacuum type only collect about 50% of the clippings leaving me with a sink cleaning job regardless, so I have not missed the vacuum at all. It make short work of the job, needs recharging only once a year, is more reliable than the Norelcos I have had, and is quite comfortable to use -- so I am very happy with the product and recommend it highly.
  55. The Wahl 9854-600 shaver is a decent, but not a great product.<br /><br />Pros:<br /><br />- The battery is great. It charges quick and run for a long time, before it needs to be recharged again.<br />- The shaver has a nice grip.<br />- Cordless<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />- Loud. No really, this thing is a like a lawnmower on crack.<br />- It has a weak motor. Half of the time instead of trimming/cutting, the blades will actually pull hair out. That might be great for tempering your pain tolerance. Not so much for shaving, before work.<br />- You can't rinse it, or it will rust. If you want to clean the beard trimmings, you need to spend an hour using the provided brush.<br />- While the rubber handle has a great grip, it works like a magnet for the trimmed hair.<br /><br />Nothing personal against Wahl. They have some great products. However, the 9854-600 is not one of them. Do yourself a favor and pass on this product.
  56. Excellent product. Very light, easy to charge, and versatile.
  57. This is the best trimmer that I have used. This is better than Philips. Charges very quickly and retains its power after long use, I am impressed. This is the product to get if you don't have time to charge.
  58. I've been using a much cheaper POS Wahl for a year, and it's been miserable. Battery life was a mere few minutes with an overnight charge, and the motor seemed unable to handle any trimming job. I picked up this trimmer a few days ago and I'm very pleased with its performance. It charges very fast, it is very powerful, and so far the charge is holding nicely. As others have said, 90% of the attachments are useless and should be thrown out. The only one I can ever see myself using is the very nice 6 position adjustable head. It attaches to the trimmer head very securely, and holds its setting very securely too. Also previously mentioned is the fact that the rubber grip tends to attract and hold clipped whiskers, which is true. But who cares? All in all, definitely worth every penny. I only wish I'd have thrown away my old trimmer a year ago and bought this one.
  59. I bought this just over a year ago and was extremely happy about how well this worked, and continued to work. About 6 months ago, I started noticing that the battery wasn't holding as much of a charge as it used to. I thought nothing of it since it would still last 3-4 shaves (~30-40 min), but then as the months rolled on it got worse and worse to the point that it would barely make it through a single shave without needing a bump of juice (and about 5-10 extra minutes of waiting). Now, it barely lasts 5 minutes on a \\"full\\" charge and 5-10 minute bump charges only give it around a minute. Needless to say, it now takes over an hour for a full trim, which is absolutely unacceptable. With that said, I'm moving on to the [[ASIN:B0037HP9OA Philips Norelco BG2040/34 Philips Norelco Bodygroom Pro Grooming System, Black / Silver]] for all my trimming needs. I think I can deal with the relative lack of power and overnight charge time to gain the convenience of never having to switch out another attachment or cutting head.
  60. I only use it to shave my face, I don't use any of the attachments. That being said, this is the best Wahl I have ever used. Shaving doesn't irritate like with previous Wahls. The improvement has made my life better. I highly recommend it.

  69. I was pleased with this trimmer at first but after about 8 months it quit holding a charge. When new it was powerful enough to get through my head and beard with ease several times. Now, it seems to drain overnight whether used or not. I agree with previous posters that the extra attachments would be better suited as an addition purchase if desired. They are not easily changed and some will never be used. I will try to contact Wahl's customer service department since they seem to offer a generous warranty, but the original packaging is long gone.
  70. After I got tired of shaving multiple times a week with a razor(Gillette Pro Glide), I decided on growing a short beard(a few weeks growth) but keeping my neck lined up and looking clean so I bought this trimmer. It's ridiculous how many useless accessories came with the package. Every one of the attachments didn't even work correctly. Anyways, it was alright the first couple of weeks but I got tired of the beard and used the bare clippers to help shave them off since they would have clogged up my razor each swipe. Wow...this thing pulls hair all over my face and neck while leaving many uneven hairs. Even after I went over the uneven areas multiple times, it still wasn't cutting them. Once I got to the thicker part of my beard (chin), the trimmer started to pull hairs left and right which was painful and annoying while STILL leaving even more uncut randoms. I don't even have a really thick beard, just coarse hair. All in all, if you have thick or coarse facial hair, look the other way. There are better trimmers/shavers out there for nearly the same price. I haven't had a problem with the battery although I do charge it overnight if I am going to use it the next day. The biggest downside was its inability to trim facial hair without leaving scraggly uncut pieces. I use it as a personal groomer which seems to work better because of the thin hair on my chest and stomach. After an overnight charge, it turns on like a chainsaw and goes to work on the body grooming, but not on my face for some reason. I like the \\"3 days growth\\" look so I will be buying a stubble type trimmer soon. One thing is for sure, I will never buy WAHL again.
  71. The trimmer works very well, it cut through my thick grey mustache and sideburn area with ease. The attachments work well. And changing trimmer heads is straightforward and snap into place with precision.<br /><br />Now the bad. Have had to have it replaced twice due to the PITA charging procedure. After talking with A lady at Wahl, it is finally clear that you should not charge for more than a hour, even if completely dead, and not to charge it until completely dead. Sorry but I have more important things in life to do than to be tied to a charging routine. When this baby dies again, it will be back to a regular battery trimmer.
  72. I see a lot of positive reviews so I suspect perhaps my style of trimming just isn't compatible with this device? I had been using a Norelco for some years, but I had lost some of the guards for the unit, rather then looking at replacements on the guards I thought I'd just upgrade to a new trimmer, and this seemed like a good unit.<br /><br />First thing I noticed was that the different heads are difficult to change. After several months with the device, I still had difficulty swapping out the trimmer and clipper blades, it always felt like I was forcing those heads on incorrectly, the different guards were especially difficult to attach & remove, I suspect were I to continue using this device long term I would have eventually damage the guards in the process of interchanging them.<br /><br />And maybe a silly complaint, but I was also disappointed in the tray the unit comes with for storing. My last trimmer had a great tray that tucked the wire in a way that I could easily pull it off and pop it on the charger, and had a tray they fit all the accessories to store them in a very clean manner. This unit does nothing with the wire, so every time you lift the unit off the wire is going to come with it, and you have to detach it from there. And its genuinely just a tray, so the attachments more or less just lay in there against the other accessories, so even after you get everything in there all nice and organized as soon as you pick up a different accessory everything is just going to shift and move. I also found cleaning the accessories and blades to be a pain, hair seems to really find a way to get tucked in there.<br /><br />The biggest disappointment for me is the trimming itself. The blade and guard design never gave me a clean, even shave, and creating fades never worked as well as it had with my previous (or current) Norelco. I'd have to run the trimmer over the same areas several times and it still seemed to just keep missing spots. I somehow learned to settle with the results, though mostly by cleaning up the beard with a pair of scissors after. But having recently moved back to a Norelco unit (Norelco Qg3280), I see now how poor a job the Wahl trimmer had been doing. Without sounding like too much of an ad for Norelco, the Norelco guards and blades on my current unit very simply and easily provide the clean, even trimming that I had been struggling to get with the Wahl unit. The first time trying my Norelco to see if it'd be a suitable replacement proved to be such an immediate and obvious improvement that I immediately discarded the Wahl unit and have not looked back.o settle with the results, though mostly by cleaning up the beard with a pair of scissors after. But having recently moved back to a Norelco unit (Norelco Qg3280), I see now how poor a job the Wahl trimmer had been doing. Without sounding like too much of an ad for Norelco, the Norelco guards and blades on my current unit very simply and easily provide the clean, even trimming that I had been struggling to get with the Wahl unit. The first time trying my Norelco to see if it'd be a suitable replacement proved to be such an immediate and obvious improvement that I immediately discarded the Wahl unit and have not looked back.
  73. I don't understand why companies are still using ni-cad on shavers and trimmers. I had a shaver that died in just over a year. Ni-cads are old school type of batteries and perform poorly. This Wahl uses Li-ion, besides being lightweight, is more powerful, lasts a long time between charges, and charges quickly.<br /><br />It is very versatile with multiple attachments for trimming beards, as a nose-ear-eyebrow timmer, stubble shaver and hair clipper. There are different comb lengths included (but why not combine these into one adjustable comb- I have seen those on other models).<br /><br />As a nose trimmer, I prefer the round tip instead of this with sharp edges.<br /><br />Cons:<br />- Hair clipper is very narrow.<br />- Not as sleek looking with its plain industrial design<br />- Nose trimmer is a bit uncomfortable

I just wanted something for those emergency shaves, but most important as a daily beard and mustache trimmer and for haircut touchups. I find it a great instrument for those tasks. If I find myself running late in the morning the shaver works okay, but nothing I would use every day. The trimmer is a great device; use it just about every day until it dies and have only charged it THREE times so far! I don't `brush' the trimmer clean as much as I should, and have oiled it once since I bought it; and it still runs like the first day I used it. As for the accessories: I kept the six-position Guide, Dual Shaver, Precious Detailer, and the Clipper Blade. The other plastic parts I would never use I just threw away, considered them \\"fluff\\" to make me think I got my monies worth. To each his own. For this price it is not perfect but I will buy it again when this one quits working.

I'm in the market for a similar product again, and this brand is off my list of considerations.<br /><br />** Note: I've upgraded from 2 stars to 3 stars because of the service the company provided when I wasn't happy w/ the product.   89. Wouldn't buy again. 1st issue was/is poor battery contact, i.e., runs like battery is going dead when used at normal angles, speed zips right up when turned to non-useful angles. 2nd issue: The beard clipper gave up the ghost after about 8 or 9 uses. There are two springs in it, one spring snapped rendering clipper useless.
  90. This product has a fatal flaw; the trimmer's internals can't handle the torque of the motor and fail within days. Basically the springs that return the blades to their original position during trimming snap off and render the unit useless. It buzzes erratically and that's that. I purchased my first unit in september and it last for 3 days before the springs snap. My second unit was shipped to me, which then lasted me 2 weeks before the same failure occurred. THe problem is NOT user induced, the trimmer could be left on on a table for 10 minutes a day and the same would occur within a few days. On a positive note, it trimmed really well while it worked. Battery lasted far longer than anything I've used and it had plenty of power. It's a real shame because i was staring to love this thing. Dont buy it, try something else or suffer the same result in a few days.

  98. I have tried several other products, and this one is the best for overall cutting and trimming. This Wahl trimmer is lightweight plastic, and probably not built for the ages. But the two cutting and one trimming head pop off the body of the trimmer and are easily replaced. The size of the heads is perfect. The largest one is big enough to clip my entire (bald) head. The littlest one is the right size to go around the ears and catch the stray hairs on the top of my head without creating big bare rectangles if I accidentally touch the skin. The plastic guards that set the length of hair fit on and off easily and do not flex when I trim. The battery has sufficient charge to finish the job. High marks to this product - a very reasonable price for a very good trimmer.
  99. If you want to save money and time, and still look great, this groomer is a product you'll want to try.<br /><br />Though made specifically for men, a little experimenting convinced me that parts of the system can be used effectively for women's grooming too. (Why not?)<br /><br />A couple examples of how women can best use the groomer:<br /><br />1) the dual head shaver does a great job with little \\"touch up\\" grooming jobs (as in toes, and around ankles, or anywhere else that you missed when you didn't have your glasses on, or were grooming by candlelight in the bathroom).<br />2) the clipper blade is great for those of us with short-hairdo's--to touch up necklines between salon visits.<br /><br />These pieces, as well of the rest of the system (11 pieces total) is an efficient way for men to get a fresh from the barber/stylist look at a fraction of the cost.<br /><br />Also, for any man or woman who hates the commitment of stylist/barber appointments -- time is money, as they say, and you'll save both with the Wahl groomer.<br /><br />The long-life-charge of this system is also worth the price of admission. Ever had a trimmer run out of juice in the middle of trimming someone's hair? There's less possibility of that because this model can hold it's charge for up to 10x longer than other models. (This means almost no charge-loss while the unit is in storage.)<br /><br />In short, if you're into home grooming, you're going to like this product!
  100. I've waited a long time for Lithium Ion batteries to replace the inferior NiCad batteries in grooming appliances. Finally Wahl has caught on used the powerful, long lasting batteries in a great little trimmer. The battery holds a charge for an extremely long time, and recharging only takes about an hour. It also provides enough juice to tackle just about any facial hair.<br /><br />This trimmer is indeed quite powerful, one of the most powerful on the market today. It makes quick work of even the thickest beards, and you may actually need to be careful when shaving around delicate areas.<br /><br />Although the battery choice is excellent, and the cutters are solid, the flaws in this device lie with the accessories. This is not due to lack of attachments, as there are nearly a dozen included. There actually are too many attachments, which overcomplicate using the device and create far too many small parts that could be lost. While some of the attachments are quite useful, some are flimsy and near useless, such as the eyebrow trimmer. The plethora of attachments should have been combined into a small handful of adjustable ones instead.<br /><br />Although lacking an adjustable trimmer attachment, this device is still an excellent trimmer, with a rock solid motor and great battery. While I can't give it five stars, it is definitely a purchase worth considering.

I was also disappointed with the closeness of the dual shaver -- it was nothing near razor quality, and again, having no indication of it needing or having a charge, the razor would abruptly stop halfway through shaving, which proved especially irritating on a recent trip.<br /><br />Considering the numerous 4- and 5-star reviews here, it would be fair to guess that I may have received a defective trimmer. Those short and few times it did work, however, I wasn't convinced that it was a product of high enough quality to supplant a razor, or one reliable enough for use during travel or vacations.

  108. I am replacing my old Wahl shaver with this new All in One Trimmer. My wife gives me a trim on the weekends..I have very little hair on top which means I need haircuts often to look nice. I am impressed with this new shaver. It is well made and the design is well thought out. The issues I have with it are minor....first the base that holds the unit and the attachments needs improvement...you really don't know what goes where and they don't really fit well. The wire that charges the shaver is unruly...it is hard to control because the designer did not plan the connection to the base unit very well. It should be like the new Norelco razor platform! The manual is not very useful if you are trying to figure out what attachment does what or how much hair each attachment will cut. The attachment for getting a close shave works in some ways better than my everyday shaver! It retains charge very well. The fit and finish of the shaver is very good. I would recommend this shaver to anyone.

  110. I have had this incredible trimmer for over two weeks. Charged for just over an hour when I received it, it has been running full strength ever since. The claims for the lithium battery are not hype. Wahl has scored big with this model. Its design and execution are superb.<br /><br />I just wish I hadn't bought all those separate pieces in the past (trimmer, nose clippers, T-blade, etc.). For much less money, I could have bought this unit and had them all. The pieces are easily interchanged, once used to the process, and the components are beautiful designed and engineered to fit perfectly. The blades are highest quality, easily maintained, and the high torque of the motor make them great trimmers.<br /><br />Wahl could have written a better manual, better describing how to change blades. But with little touble, and a modicum of common sense, the skill is acquired easily. The people who say the blades broke just made a mess of it themselves by forcing. Never a good idea with any piece of equipment. Though well within reason, the unit is not as quiet as a good Andis trimmer, but you get many more options for less money. A fair trade-off in my book. And nobody else has the battery and power of this Wahl.<br /><br />The shaving attachment is rather amazing, and useful, but don't expect the kind of close shave that a dedicated Norelco will give. It is just for convenience and, considering the cost of this set, a rather nice throw-in -- especially for traveling when you don't want a bunch of extra things to pack and carry.<br /><br />The comb attachments fit securely and, when used with the trimming blade, do a beautiful, easy job. Again, common sense required.<br /><br />You may need, or want, a larger clipper for big hair cutting jobs but, for any kind of trim, this is your tool.<br /><br />PRODUCT UPDATE: One full month after that same one-hour charge mentioned above, this amazing unit is still going strong. No diminishing of power at all. Bought a second unit when price dropped radically one day.

  129. I read a lot of the reviews and that helped me make my decision. I've had this trimmer a couple of months now, and really love it. I'll start with the points I did NOT find easily in other reviews Yes, it does a great job trimming the edges of your mustache above the lip, etc. I've had all-in-one beard groomers where the trimming attachment did not cut well. Not so with this one. The first time I used it I was instantly showing a lot more lip than I had planned on. In other words, it trims mustaches better than anything I have used before. The other point I was unclear about in other reviews was the usefulness of the nose/ear trimmer attachment. I have owned 2 or 3 of those battery powered rotating types before, and always found them so-so. This trimmer attachment does a much better job than those, and is faster. Just stick it in your ear or nose and you're done in 2 seconds, whereas the rotary types make you keep doing it for a while before it seems like you're done. The noise level is not a problem at all for me - it's noisy but not objectionable in your ear, about the same or less noise level as my rotary trimmer. For beard trimming (I have a goatee that I keep fairly short), it works well but is slightly less convenient than the all-in-one beard groomers I have owned. You have to switch attachments, which is frankly very easy, though not as easy as just dialing in a 3 or 4 on one of those beard groomers. And the attachments are a bit of a pain because you have to either pick, for instance, a 2 or 3 beard trimmer, or else use the 6-position trimmer attachment. That 6-position trimmer attachment is what I use, and it's fine, though adjusting it's height requires a little more effort than it should. Battery life is outstanding, and what puts it above everything else. It lasted 2 months of frequent use on its first charge, and I expect it to last for years. Other beard groomers I have owned (both Panasonic) died after a couple of years and had to be plugged in. The attachments in general are a bit of a pain, as everyone else mentions. However, putting them on and off is really easy - not as complicated (at least to me) as others have mentioned. I keep them all in the tray on my countertop and it works fairly well. The tray gets really crowded, so I've take some of the attachments I'm never going to use and put them in a drawer. It is nice to have your oil and brush right there whenever you need them - otherwise I would not clean and oil it as often as I should:) For haircutting, I agree with everyone else. This thing is really narrow, even with the wider cutting head attached. It's about half the width of my corded Wahl trimmer, which is what I've been using to cut my hair (and does a great job). Also, the attachments are not long enough for my hair, which normally takes a 4 and a 5 attachment. Not sure if you can buy longer attachments for it or not. I think the best solution is just to spend another 30 bucks on the corded Wahl unit like I did. It's a beast, seems to actually dim the lights when you turn it on (semi-kidding here but you get the idea). For all around trimming, meaning sideburns and hairline at back of neck, it's super. The normal attachment does a great job of shaping your hair and cuts super sharp. In sum - it's outstanding for moustache/ear/nose trimming as well as shaping your beard or hair at the edges. Don't bother thinking it's going to be very good for actually cutting your hair.
  130. Fantastic Trimmer. Have one but broke the adjustable length comb when I dropped it. My daughter bought me another brand for Christmas. It was a good one but my shelf broke and both it and my Wahl Trimmer fell in the toilet. Soaking in toilet water over night doesnt really help a trimmer. So it is time to buy a new one and it has to be a WAHL.
  131. This is a sturdy and dependable product. The blades are well-machined, and the battery life is phenomenal. It is barbershop quality. The vast selection of included attachments should address every need. No one person needs them all, but it is important to have the options to try when you receive the machine. Choose the attachment(s) you need in the first few days of ownership, then store the rest. This is an outstanding product.
  132. Battery last for quite a while, strong motor, good attachments. Overall I am very satisfied.
  133. I use this trimmer regularly and recommended it to a friend, who also bought one.
  134. This is a very powerful trimmer, but it has a major flaw in the design. I love the power and the attachments, they all work perfectly. The big problem is the black grip that you hold on to. It's made of a high grip type of rubber that does make it very easy to hold, but your trimmed hairs will stick to it. You can not just wipe them off or brush them off, you have to use a wet towel to clean it. To me this is a very bad design and I can't believe it made it through testing without people complaining about it.<br /><br />I gave it an overall score of 3 stars, 5 for trimmer functionality, and 1 for handle design.
  135. I have always had a cheap trimmer. My wife told me I should buy a quality trimmer I could keep for a long time. Her mother is a hair stylist and recommended this brand. It has been by far the best trimmer I have ever owned. I strongly recommend it to anyone who is willing to invest a little more in a quality product that performs well and will last for a long time.
  136. Way more options and attachments that I should ever need, but once I found the right settings it works great. Nice size and good trimming capabilities. But be careful not to shave when you aren't awake yet ... may result in divots that take a few days to grow back!

I haven't managed to get it apart yet either. Looks like rolling the silicone sleeve over itself and off the back may allow you to get to a place where you can pop some plastic clips to open it up. Maybe I can find a battery model number so I can order one for replacement. Looks like planned obsolescence...

  140. Bought this because we had a WAHL years ago and it served us (and our dog) well. PROS: I liked the idea of its light weight due to a lithium battery. That part is great. It also gives a fairly decent haircut. CONS: #1 My husband tried the shaver and was disappointed. His Norelco is far superior. #2 We didn't need all 17 attachments for beard, mustache, nose or a face shaver, but they don't sell a lithium battery one for just hair cuts. So we had to purchase the whole kit and caboddle! #3 It is awkward to change the heads; you have to line them up just right. I fear that a piece of the plastic holder will snap off easily. #4 Having had a sliding comb attachment on our former Panasonic shaver, it is a pain to have to change the combs and there is nothing to catch the hair, so it makes a big mess. #5 The packaging is terrible - light, flimsy and cheap! #6 There is no good way to store it - the \\"holder\\" (shown) is worthless and putting it back in its original box is difficult. And finally, #7 there is no pouch you can use to transport it to the office or on vacation. Sorry WAHL, you'll have to go back to the drawing board! And keep it simple! More is not better.
  141. The trimmer works great, but there are so many attachments, one needs a file system to keep track of them. I'm not sure of the necessity, but then that's just me.
  142. I specifically wanted to get a Lithium Ion Beard Trimmer because I was frustrated with my Ni-Cad trimmer which could not hold a charge any longer. Within two days I had to recharge it. This was the only Lithium Ion beard trimmer I found. I had a Lithium Ion shaver and the battery life on it was great. Often did not need to take the recharger cord with me on week long trips. I have had this trimmer for a little over a month and I have not recharged it since the initial charge. There are a lot of attachments if you are just looking for a facial hair trimmer. The trimmer is geared towards trimming up or shaving hair anywhere on the body. If I were to downgrade it anywhere it is on the noise hair trimmer. Works ok but my previous trimmer was better in this regard. I saw a few comments that changing the heads is hard but I have not found that to be the case. They come off easily and as you long as you align the head correctly it goes back on quickly also. After doing it a couple of times should not have any issue. Hats off to Wahl for developing the first Lithium Ion Trimmer. While it is slightly more pricey than the Ni-Cad versions it is well worth it in my opinion.

If you live with mom/wife/roommate, they will destroy your trimmer battery by ONLY unplugging it from the wall in the bathroom and not unplugging it at the shaver.   163. I will try and keep this VERY simple and relatively short. I have extremely coarse hair all over my entire body. I have been trimming it since I was young. They have all burned out, failed, ALWAYS DULLED or had eventual battery problems. Do NOT buy into \\"super strong titanium coated blades\\" \\"blades that never need oiling\\" and any other claim from trimmers with standard batteries and CHEAP blades that WILL fail and need to be replaced. WAHL is making the BEST and most POWERFUL rechargeable all in one groomer you will ever find to date. I have never been able to trim all my body hair at once EVER simply because a standard charge is 30-50 mins. You will lose power and have to charge for 8-12 hours. This is inconvenient and weak. This trimmer has a ONE HOUR CHARGE, a quick charge function and keeps its power full on for 3 HOURS! The blades are extremely high quality and it powers through any hair type without choking ever. The competition simply has not lived up to this trimmer/shaver/all in one. DO NOT PAY MORE, DON'T LET THE PACKAGING HYPE FOOL YOU.   168. My original title for this review was: \\"OK if you consider $40 reasonable for a disposable razor!\\"<br />I have since updated from 2 to 4 stars after the update.<br /><br />I'm very disappointed with this razor. I have only owned it for about 3 months and its pretty much worthless now. The razor worked OK while it was operational, but OK is all I can say. I didn't notice anything special to justify the price which was roughly 3X the amount of other units. I have NEVER had good luck when it comes to these types of razors. I wear a medium stubble trimmed beard which I trim maybe once a week, sometimes every other week. For some reason, these type of razors always die within a matter of months. After reading lots of positive reviews and using the 5yr warranty as a feel good reinforcement, I decided to give the Lithium Ion a try, even with the high price tag, I figured \\"you get what you pay for\\". I was wrong. Like I said previously, the unit worked OK for about 3 months (used it 10-20 times MAX). The razor ran on the initial charge that entire time which surprised and pleased me. The problem came when the battery finally died (it just shut off in the middle of the shave, it doesn't have an indicator light). I recharged it for a few hours only to unplug it and find it still dead! I plugged it in again for a few hours and still nothing. I then turned it on while plugged in, then unplugged it. It was like jump starting a car! It worked, but only for a few seconds. I plugged it in again and turned it on and it died again in a few seconds, this time while still plugged in. So it appears if the battery has any issues at all, the unit is useless. I moved a month ago and I threw away the box so I'm not even going to bother seeking a replacement from Wahl. I consider it a lesson learned and forty dollars down the drain. I just bought the Remington All-In-1 for fifteen dollars and I'm going to give that a try.<br /><br />Update 3-22-12<br />About 3 months after I wrote the initial review I decided to pull this trimmer out of the draw to throw it away. I tried to turn it on out of curiosity and sure it enough it worked! There must have been a short circuit or something because the unit has worked fine ever since. I have even recharged it and that didn't kill it again so I'm happy. I initially replaced this with the previously mentioned Remington (which wasn't very good). In comparing the two, the Wahl has a MUCH stronger motor and solid feel. The attachments are more accurate as well. I really wish they put some sort of charging indicator light on this but I'll live. I originally didn't think this was built any better than competing products but after more time I was proven wrong. I think this is definitely worth more $ so long as it stays alive!

  170. This trimmer definitely does what it's intended to do, although a bit sparatically. Missed hairs on a regular basis but is very powerful and it makes for a quick trim, just requires a few extra passes than expected. The attachments are functionable, and provide a very close trim, the precision trimmer is quite impressive but heats up a little bit after prolonged use, be hasty with the nose hairs. The shaving foil leaves a little bit to be desired, especially if your facial hair grows in multiple directions. Very sleek and contemporary design makes it visually pleasing, the rubberized gripping is a nice touch. Trying to make all the accesories fit in the tiny tray that is supplied can be frustrating at times. . . But definitely not a dealbreaker.<br /><br />Overall, a quality product for the price paid. Thanks for the great deal!
  171. At first, I used to have to keep my old cordless trimmer on the charger anytime i wasn't using it. Eventually, my old cordless basically became corded. The Wahl LiIon is amazing. I probably shave my head every 2 weeks and my beard once a week and I charge my Wahl probably once every 2-3 months. It's the greatest thing ever. The shaver attachment is useless on my face, YMMV but the beard and hair trimmers are perfect. Word of warning, the #1 blade is definitely shorter than any other #1 i've used. If other #1's are 1/8\\" this thing is like 1/12\\" or something. It's noticeably shorter by about 4 days growth. What sucks is the #2 is, instead of 1/4\\" somewhere between a normal #1 and #2. So consider the #1 more like #.75 and the #2 more like a #1.5. I wish this was adjustable but I've gotten used to the super close #1 and it's fine I guess.

  187. I used to use an electric razor/trimmer made by remington. When it died, I didn't want to spend the $100+ on a new razor, so I decided to try this. Right out of the box, I was impressed. It even came charged. This thing works great for a pretty clean shave, or just trimming your goatee,mustache, or sideburns, etc. Now obviously it's not as close as a razor and shaving cream, but it's as close as any electric razor I've had. Even though this was only $32 for me, compared to my $150 remington, it cuts through the hair probably about 10 times as fast, without snagging,(when properly used,) is easier to clean, and is more solidly built. As long as you aren't the type of guy who HAS to shave with a regular razor in order to not have scruff, the Wahl should fit most, if not all of your needs. Just as an example of how powerful it is, let me tell you, if I wanted, I could easily use this thing to shave all the hair off my head, probably in about 2-3 minutes... and I have a very large and bushy head of hair. This product is well worth the money. Saved me from spending at least $70 more, and from the hassle and irritation of old fashioned shaving.<br /><br />Update: After about 6 months, the battery holds almost no charge, so it must be plugged in for several minutes prior to and during use. This is no problem for me. It still works great and I have no doubt it's the best electric for the price by far.

Maybe about 4 or 5 of them, none lasted but one and it was one of those three circle razor deals. The wahl lithium Ion is simply a great product I never seen anything like it. I received my clipper on September 11, I charged it over night and used it for the first time the next day. I didn't use it with the charger while I was using it and never put it on the charger again. During the time it was off the charger I maybe used it 6 times. I cut my own hair and it takes me about 40 - 45 minutes, this because I also trim my bread. This single charge (and here's the amazing part), last exactly 1 month and 7 days, or 5 weeks. I started to cut my hair on the 19 of October, and the clipper went dead, I charged it for 2 minutes, and finished my hair cut. I never saw anything like this, this product would be a perfect travel companion, many time I've traveled and have to take two different clippers and there chargers and if I don't charge them right away, they lose there charge with this product you won't have to worry about that. I really love this item.
  192. Wahl has a reputation for good professional trimmers, but they really dropped the ball on this one due to poor quality accessories. The advertising brags at length about the battery, and I guess its a good one, and the motor seems high quality, but the blades and guides are junk. Here are my complaints: o the blades and guides are frustratingly difficult to change o the 6 position guide is very difficult to adjust and in the course of doing so the top part of it popped off. Difficult to put back together. o I dropped the trimmer blade (about two feet) and it popped apart into three pieces. Trying to get it back together I bent the spring. I guess I could have been more successful by unscrewing it and reassembling it, but why am I bothering with this in the first place? I just want to trim my mustache. o The plastic base is useless. o There are too many pieces. o One of the guides was missing, while the package contained two of the same size. Sloppy packaging. I think Wahl should be ashamed to ship one of their motors with cheap plastic accessories that fall apart if you stare at them too hard. Instead, I bought the Remington MB-200 and the difference is like night and day. The Remington has only one guide and an easy to use thumb wheel to adjust the length. The attachments can be difficult to remove. It would often remove the trimmer piece itself which doesn't always snap on easily. Last but not least, after about a year the device just died on me. I thought it just needed to be charged but after charging it for an entire day, it still didn't work. I will find a different brand to replace this unit.
  217. I personally feel the \\"lithium\\" battery was trumped up in terms of creating the impression of charge holding longevity. My former Norelco was a class act when it came to battery life.   226. (This is an updated review) My previous comment explained the annoyance of Wahl's warranty service. The warranty description sent with the product says to \\"mail your product prepaid\\" and to \\"enclose a check or money order in the amount of $6.50 to cover handling.\\" This would result in around $10 (or 25% of the purchase price) to get it fixed. Instead, I ignored this and contacted Wahl via their website, and ended up getting the warranty done with no cost to me. A Wahl representative responded to my original amazon comment stating that my comment (that is, my quotation of product warranty) does not accurately reflect Wahl's service. And indeed he's right; warranty service worked as it should. So, when in doubt, contact someone, and don't follow the written instruction unless you have to. It'd be nice if the warranty description that comes with the product was accurate, but given that the instruction booklet that comes with the trimmer is rather generic (describes features of other models as well), I'm guessing they haven't updated that text in a long time. (As for the product defect, the motor in mine would turn off when i flipped it upside down. Run yours through warranty if you experience the same)

  233. This personal grooming set has a lot of attachments, but unfortunately, it seems to try to do too much in one little unit. The shaver attachment did not shave very well the first time I use dit. The second time was ok, but again, the attachment was so small it would have taken all day to try to shave. All the attachments come with a tray, but unfortunately there is no real way to organize anything on it, and I think it would be better to just toss everything into a little plastic storage container than to use this tray that came with it. If you are looking for a personal grooming set, this would probably be ok, but if you're looking for an all-in-one trimmer set that you can use for haircutting, you should probably look at something else.
  234. Right out of the package I was impressed with all of the included blades and attachments. They can be used interchangeably by easily snapping on or off of the main unit. It was easy to hold on to and I was able to easily guide it where I needed it as I was trimming my husband's hair. It was quick and easy to give him a short even cut using the comb attachment. I was very happy also that after removing the comb I was able to clean up the neckline and remove the little fine neck hairs in a Jiff. The blade was sharp and cut cleanly and quickly without any skin pinching or nicks. Dave trimmed up his mustache and eyebrows quickly, too. I recommend this trimmer for it's ease of use, variety of specialty attachments that snap on and off and for it's superb cutting power.

  250. I ordered this trimmer after some bad battery experiences with Conair trimmers in the past. The battery and motor are in fact higher powered than the ones on the trimmers I'd used before and it felt good to know I wouldn't run out of charge in the middle of a trim. But I returned this trimmer after only a couple days for one annoying and seemingly trivial reason - without a guard, the blades cut very, very close. But with the #1 beard guard, they cut almost nothing off my goatee with 3 days worth of growth on it. I've used a #1 guard on my beard for several years and this one is simply too deep. I tried using it without the guard and it looked like I was trying to trim off my beard entirely. With the guard, I'd have to trim my beard daily and even then it would still be too long. Other trimmers have adjustable blade depth without using a guard and I measured that my previous trimmer had a #1 guard that was much shallower. Overall this is a powerful trimmer with sharp blades and nice construction, loaded down with attachments that either don't work properly or add very little value. The tray for the attachments is huge (as others here have noted) and would take up too much space on my countertop, too. The non-slip grip surface of the handle is also a dust and lint magnet. But I'm disappointed because the trimmer is clearly well made - I just wish I could put a guard on it that was the right depth for my needs.

  257. This trimmer and its accessories will trim all beards, mustaches, brows, and other body hair. Additionally, if one's hair is thin and sparse (as mine is), the trimmer will do one's complete head. I did mine in fifteen minutes, going from safer to shorter in two passes. A PERSPECTIVE: Concerning the comments of those who choose to nitpick what they perceive as shortcomings -- perhaps the comments of those who shouldn't be allowed to own mechanical devices of any kind -- this is my take on that criticism. VALUE: There are very few better bargains in the world than the 32 bucks one will pay for this comprehensive grooming kit. NOISE: The unit is not noisy unless compared to dead silence. HEAT: Eventually, after many minutes of use, some of the cutters will become warm. Perhaps even perceptibly to those of particularly delicate sensibilities. CUTTING HEADS: All of the heads perform their respective functions for which they were designed. QUALITY: The power unit is outstanding. The heads and the various cutting guides attach easily and precisely. A RECOMMENDATION: Spend the 32 bucks for the trimmer and enjoy hands-on personal grooming. --Ron UPDATE 07-12-2011: WHOA, THERE! LET ME SAVE YOU SOME MONEY. If you go bald on top or wear a buzz cut, don't spend the bucks for a larger, more powerful clipper. I did, along with 10 clipper combs, and I don't use the larger clipper at all. I'll hold on to it, however, maybe someday I'll have a dog. The Wahl All In One Trimmer will handle your buzz cut and your beard trimming. A foil shaver for my head and neck and the All In One for beard, eyebrows, nose, and ears are keeping me neatly trimmed. --Ron

  268. The li-on battery is a great feature on this trimmer, as it lasts for a long time and charges quickly. Otherwise this product is a bit sub-par. I use the trimmer exclusively to maintain my beard, which I keep short and neat yet longer than stubble. The \\"adjustable\\" trimmer guard is a nightmare and extremely difficult to both adjust and remove for cleaning. The model includes a few fixed length guards as well, of which I use the middle size instead. It serves well enough, but it's not the exact length I would like, and even this fixed attachment is still more difficult to remove and replace than other attachments I have used with cheaper trimmers.<br /><br />The rubberized grip attracts hair trimmings like a magnet, which then stick and do not brush off easily. A wet washcloth does wipe them off, but what a pain! There's no need for a sticky rubber grip on a trimmer, and it's not even that comfortable to hold.<br /><br />Worst of all, I occasionally feel the trimmer pull one of my hairs rather than clip it. It's not so painful but it's certainly uncomfortable, and I would expect better from a product in this price range. My last trimmer never pulled hairs, and it cost half as much. This is a rare problem, but there's really no excuse.<br /><br />The excellent battery combined with the $40 I've spent keeps me using this trimmer, but I'll happily abandon it in the future for a better li-on model should one become available.

  272. This is an incredible trimmer. Powerful, with many attachments. If you need to trim something, this can definitely do the job.<br /><br />The downside to this flexibility is the box of replacement heads, combs, and shavers that come along with it. I'm not even sure which attachment to use, as the single page of tiny instructions doesn't identify them. At first, I thought it was really cool to have all these options, but now I'm just wondering if they couldn't have narrowed it down by using a smaller number of more adjustable items. Plus, I'm not sure where I'm going to keep all of them, as there isn't a container or case provided.<br /><br />I'm only going to take off one star for this because I believe most users will settle on a single head, and a single comb, and put all the other attachments in a ziplock bag in their closet. At that point, you are left with a clipper that is very powerful, does exactly what you need it to do, and doesn't require a cord.<br /><br />Pros:<br /><br />- Powerful. More powerful than the plug-in versions from other manufacturers.<br />- Very good at cutting the hairs without pulling them.<br />- Can get as close a cut as you need, all the way down to a shave (a shaver head is included).<br />- Lightweight, but sturdy. Easy to hold and maneuver. Feels very professional.<br /><br />Cons:<br /><br />- Too many attachments<br />- Instructions do not cover the purpose of most of the attachments.<br />- Default head is very narrow (though it comes with wider ones).<br />- Not washable or waterproof.<br />- No case.<br /><br />Sean P. Logue, 2008
  273. I bought this trimmer for my nephew for last Christmas. This fall, 2013, he survived an F4 tornado by getting to the basement of his house in the nick of time.   274. Let's start right into it...<br /><br />^+++ Pros +++^<br />+ Compact size (diameter is between a C and D sized battery)<br />+ Excellent power<br />+ Comes with 4 Blade options; Trimmer, Detailer, Dual-Shaver and Clipper<br />+ Comes with 7 Blade Guides: Facial Hair, Ear, Nose & Brow, Sideburns, Neckline, Body Grooming and Hair Cut...One of them being a 6-position trimmer.<br />+ Easy Pop in/out design for the Blades<br />+ Comes with a well thought out tray for holding everything (including the little oil bottle that comes with it)<br /><br />^--- Cons ---^<br />- No charge indicator...Not really a big deal, considering it's got a 1-minute quick charge ability.<br />- The Tray is great for holding all the blades and accessories, but the Shaver itself sits a bit loose and the charge wire doesn't stay in place well (if you wanted to keep it on the tray).<br /><br />^** Thoughts & Opinions<br />I've had a goatee for going on 15 years now, so I've been through my fair share of trimmers/detailers. My most recent trimmer (before getting this Wahl) is the Philips Norelco T980 Turbo Vacuum. I love it, the capable vacuum alone makes it great but it also plows through my copperwire-like face hair with ease and has a built-in multi-position trimmer. It's great for what it does as a trimmer, but woefully deficient as a detailer (hence wanting this Wahl with all the options).<br /><br />The Wahl, on the other hand, is also quite the capable beast but where the T980 is really only good as a Trimmer, the Wahl tries to be a little of everything and in my opinion fairly well succeeds.<br /><br />The high-torque motor partnered with LiOn power is a great combo. I use an electric shaver (Braun 7680) for day-to-day and the Wahl every few days for the goatee. The high-torque means a fast and accurate trim (lesser trimmers you have to keep running over the same area over and over) and the LiOn means I don't have to worry if I've got enough charge left to get a good trim.<br /><br />I have to admit that I really appreciate the shaver/blade/accessories tray that comes with this Wahl. I was always losing bit and pieces from other trimmers, but with this tray I can keep everything together.<br /><br />Powerful, long lasting charge, lots of clipping/trimming/detailing options and a tray to keep all the parts together...This is a nice set, I certainly recommend it.with this Wahl. I was always losing bit and pieces from other trimmers, but with this tray I can keep everything together. Powerful, long lasting charge, lots of clipping/trimming/detailing options and a tray to keep all the parts together...This is a nice set, I certainly recommend it.
  275. We have owned several of this type of trimmer over the years, and this one falls somewhere in the middle of the pack. While we liked that Wahl is still a family-owned company, and the shaver was made in the US, the quality feels a little cheap for the price. Lightweight plastic components don't say \\"long-lasting quality\\" to me. The method of attachment is awkward, with attachments held on by stiff plastic clips which I don't believe will last particularly long if used often. It takes quite a bit of force to snap them on; making me feel pretty sure they will snap off at some point before I'm ready to be done using this product. The shaver does, however, hold a charge remarkably well, which is its main selling point. It comes with every conceivable attachment, making it versatile for any use you can think of. And it does what it claims to do: it trims and shaves hair admirably. The motor seems to have significantly more power than its predecessor at our house.<br /><br />Bottom line: it works and works well, but I don't see it having the durability to hold up to long term use. Higher quality materials would have made this a 5 star product.
  276. The standard against which a multiple use product like this is to be measured is NOT whether it is the best performing product at each task, but rather whether it performs well enough to replace two or more items in your bathroom or more importantly in your carry on luggage. As a habitually clean-shaven man, I might seem a poor choice to review such a product, but a fortuitously timed job layoff has allowed me to grow a beard in order to fully test the device.<br /><br />BATTERY: This is the major selling point; I fully charged it when I received it and have been using it off and on over the last two months ON THE VERY FIRST CHARGE, and it is still going strong! There is no other rechargeable battery technology I'm aware of that could even approach, much less match that performance.<br /><br />SHAVER HEAD: As a blade shaver whose weapon of choice is the [[ASIN:B000XVXK12 Gillette Fusion Power Phenom Razor]], I have always believed that electric razors are for men who don't really insist on a close shave (or less facetiously for men whose lifestyle requires shaving on-the-go). Nothing about the performance of this trimmer's shaver head has changed my mind, and for shaving the entire face it is clearly inferior to the [[ASIN:B001FA1F8K Braun Series 1 1-150 Men's Shaver]] I have also been testing. However, in fairness, it was never really intended for this purpose. No man in his right mind would choose such a product unless he was planning to at least experiment with facial hair, and for the purpose of shaving those parts of your face not covered by your beard or mustache, it is quite adequate.<br /><br />DETAIL HEAD: For delicate work, like separating that unibrow into two separate eyebrows, the detail head works fine, though perhaps because of the small size of its face plate, it becomes uncomfortably warm during sustained use. However, as a nose hair or ear hair trimmer, it is clearly inferior to any with rotary heads.<br /><br />TRIMMER HEAD: The main trimmer head comes with far too many attachments IMHO, and I don't say that just because in mine all of the plastic attachments displayed in the box window were duplicated inside. Unless you are planning a career as a traveling beard stylist, a six-position trimmer guide and 3 fixed-length attachment combs is probably going to be more than you will ever need. However, experimentation will be required in order to narrow down your choices. The adjustable trimmer guide provides more choices without switching attachments, but it is susceptible to slipping under pressure, resulting in a closer trim than you intended. For body hair trimming, this device is clearly inferior to the [[ASIN:B000EG8HLE Philips Norelco BG2020 Bodygroom Shaver]], [[ASIN:B000TFNH1U Philips Norelco Body Groomer Limited Edition BG2022]], and probably to the [[ASIN:B001E0C9LI Philips Norelco BG2030 Professional BodyGrooming System]] as well, in everything except battery, but unless you are a performer in the adult film industry, it will probably do an adequate job, especially if you have someone who can assist you with the underbrush thinning.<br /><br />Note: Unless you plan on regularly maintaining yourself in that condition, it is not advisable to shave yourself too closely between the waist and the knees. Two words -- \\"razor stubble\\" -- in close contact with your most tender areas should be explanation enough.<br /><br />T-BLADE HEAD: Unless you develop the habit of using it to trim your beard or are still maintaining that boot camp 'doo, this will probably be the least useful blade unless you have a partner with some haircutting skills because while any idiot can eventually learn to trim his own beard, cutting your own hair in a manner you'd be willing to display in public is probably going to be beyond your abilities. However, Wahl made its name in hair clippers and could hardly be expected to leave one out of an all-in-one trimmer.<br /><br />Defects? The lack of a carrying case is particularly felt with such a large number of attachments, and a vacuum feature to capture hair clippings would be a nice-to-have. In addition the handle has the ergonomics of a flashlight, but these are minor points.<br /><br />In summation for a bearded or mustachioed man on the go this device CAN adequately replace everything it claims to replace with the exception of a nose hair trimmer.vacuum feature to capture hair clippings would be a nice-to-have. In addition the handle has the ergonomics of a flashlight, but these are minor points. In summation for a bearded or mustachioed man on the go this device CAN adequately replace everything it claims to replace with the exception of a nose hair trimmer.
  277. This is my first beard trimmer but I have been very pleased with it. Have been using it everyday for about 3 weeks and so far have only charged the battery at the time I opened the box. Instructions could be better, there is one adjustable attachment that so far I haven't been able to adjust due to fear of breaking it.
  278. In the beginning things were great. After 6-months the battery only held a 3-5 minute charge and requried a full 8hrs to charge back up. Very poor battery Life.
  279. Contrary to some reviews here, you cannot use it when it's not charged (but plugged-in). It only works after charging, and plugging it in while using it does not bypass the battery (so that it can be used when the battery is dead).<br /><br />For this reason, it gets 3/5.
  280. Just as advertised, Buy with confidence. No problems, works great, (I wrote this review after having it about 15 months).<br />I pretty much only use 2 attachments. This baby holds a charge for months.
  281. I bought this trimmer to replace a much older rechargeable Wahl trimmer. The old one had gotten to where it didn't cut very well, and it required recharging after every use. This new one cuts much better than the old one ever did, and a battery charge lasts much longer. I have taken this one along to places where recharging was not an option, and if worked fine for several beard trims and even touch-up haircuts.
  282. Still learning to be a beard owner/operator. I would like a guard between the 1 and 2 for my mustache; I like it a tad shorter than the beard so it does not tickle my nose.
  283. Gave this as a gift to the Hubby. He loves the attachments included and it holds a decent charge!
  284. It does a good job of shaving, although some parts of my face need several passes to get a fairly close shave. A single one-hour charge has yielded seven shaves so far. The little handbook does not give very clear instructions on the use of the various attachments.
  285. Great little trimmer with all the necessary addons to do some basic maintenance at a good price for li-ion.
  286. I replaced a basic rechargeable Wahl trimmer that had to be over 15 yr's old (battery finally went belly up), & will stop using a Braun trimmer that's difficult to use. The latter doesn't hold a charge for very long anymore, & I got tired of skin scratches as the cutting guard teeth were too sharp. I bought the Wahl Lithium Ion trimmer primarily for sideburn, neck, & \\"nether\\" region trimming purposes, as well as for the Lithium Ion battery. I too draw weary of the old cadmium rechargeable battery shortcomings (short charge durations + memory problems). I used the trim & clip attachments for sideburn, neckline (front & back), & groin trimming. The latter for me has become habit for 20+ yr's as I'm a former long distance cyclist, & you learn quickly that that area is better off smooth for cycling purposes. Fortunately, many women love it also. Both attachments afforded me a very clean, close to the skin trim with no abrasion from the cutting guard teeth. Just as important, the teeth are close together & I experienced no grabbing of skin or hair. The foil shave attachment worked as well & no better than other foil shavers I've used. I currently own a Braun rechargeable foil shaver, & neither provides me a skin smooth shave. Given my experience, I don't expect skin smooth shaves from a foil shaver. That's why I use a blade for all of my shaving - to achieve the actual skin smooth results. I also used the detail attachment on my ears & nose. I found it no more effective than a real round headed ear/nose trimmer. Given the cutting edge & angle it provides, I found it more difficult to use on my ears & nose. So for the purpose of trimming ear & nose hairs, I will continue to use my round headed ear & nose hair trimmer (from Sharper Image - Turbo Groomer 5.0). At this time I have no reason to test all of the guide combs for moustache & beard trimming purposes as I no longer have either at this time. Having used such trimmer combs in the past, I see no reason why they won't work well as they're comparable in design as anything else I've ever used. Some reviewers have noted that the trimmer is loud & bothersome. I guess it depends on what you're used to, but in my experience, it's no louder than anything I've ever used, & quiter than some. Some have also pointed out that hairs stick to the silicone rubber grip. Personally, I find that a mute point, as it's easy to wipe them off by hand or with a towel. I wouldn't base my purchasing decision on such a finding. Bottom line is that it's light weight & easy to use. The battery provides more power than cadmium rechargeable batteries, & having experienced Lithium Ion batteries in other products I own, I look forward to no longer wondering whether or not the battery will be there for me when I need it if I've not kept it plugged into the charger. The trimmer attachments provide a clean & close trim. All in all, this trimmer is worth the $40.
  287. I don't know why it is so difficult to find a good trimmer/groomer these days. I purchased a \\"cheapy\\" in 2001 that lasted for 9 years and worked great (I forget the brand). Since it finally conked out, I've been through two units - including this one - and just purchased another model - Philips Norelco Qg3280/41 - in hopes to find one I can be happy with. This trimmer could've been great. The pros include: - Long battery life - solid construction and doesn't feel cheap while holding - Good customer service. I called asking about the nose trimming attachment, and they sent me one for free! YMMV on this one. Cons: - The heads and attachments are tricky to attach. Each time, I worry I'm going to break the plastic tabs (haven't yet, though, thanks to the solid construction). - The plug doesn't detach when lifting the trimmer due to the way it was designed. My previous trimmer allowed the plug to be attached to the base so that the trimmer detached from the plug when lifting it, which I prefer. - The 6-Position Guide is worthless if you want to use \\"position 1\\" setting (the setting that gives you the closest trim). Every time I use that setting, I end up with bald patches along the trim line, and end up having to shave the entire area down/off to match. I've been stuck using position 2, which doesn't give me the close trim I prefer. The last \\"con\\" is the real deal-killer for me, as I could live with the other ones. But because I seek the closest trim available in the 6-Position Guide, all trimming attachments are useless. As I write this review, the Philips Norelco Qg3280/41 is on sale for 32 dol. so I'm going to give that a try and hope that I can end my hunt for a trimmer I can be satisfied with for the next several years.
  288. **** Update **** Within a day of posting this original review, I received different information from the company. Perhaps this was my error in initial communication, but the end result is that THEY COVERED IT FULLY UNDER WARRANTY. I had to send in the full unit with power supply. The new trimmer head works great and looks a little different - maybe it's the same, but appears to be better quality than what was initially supplied. I'm leaving this at 1 star for awhile in case people who recently read this might find it easier to see the update. Given the ultimate outcome, I would change my rating to 4 stars. *** Original review *** This product performed great for 7 months, with being used about 5-6 times a month for light trimming. The battery life is amazing (curious how battery life is the biggest thing touted on this - it is impressive). The teeth on the main trimmer head started falling out or breaking off causing the product to chomp on my face. Obviously the trimmer blade is defective and one would expect this to be covered by their highly touted FIVE YEAR WARRANTY. Sorry, it doesn't cover this defective part, no matter how limited the use. Since I used none of the other attachments, I wonder - if they broke the first time used.... of course, they would no be covered either. After reading the fine print it's hard to tell if anything at all is actually covered - why not put 100 year warranty on the package? They want $17.45 to send a replacement for the defective part. Eg, more than 50% of the cost to buy an entire new unit. I find this outrageous. They should be apologizing and rushing out a replacement at their expense. Never had Remington or Norelco fall apart like this even after years of use. When it comes to Wahl, MADE IN AMERICA means, GIVE US MORE MONEY BECAUSE WE SOLD YOU JUNK THE FIRST TIME. I expected more from an American based company. Do I really want to buy a new trimmer head twice a year and by the end of the 5 yr warranty have paid for the product 5 times over? Maybe they would offer a discount to buy a 10pack... sort of like those disposable packs of shavers. **************UPDATE By the end of the day, it appears they are going to cover this under warranty. I need to send the entire unit and power cord back to them and I'm told they will waive the return shipping fee. So, perhaps the earlier communication with them was not accurate. Will post an update about whether this gets fixed and the timing. I may need to rewrite this entire review, or delete it - we'll see how it turns out.

  294. Purchased in February, died by September. Wahl trimmers don't look as nice as the Conair line of beard trimmers. But don't be fooled; Wahl trimmers work better. The only flaws in this design are 1) the too-firm power button is virtually impossible to slide into the 'on' position if your fingers are wet, as they are frequently in a bathroom. 2) When you turn it on and it's plugged in, it won't switch from the ni-cad cell to just direct power.   297. This is my second Wahl trimmer, the first one died after about 10 years. Wahl includes a nice array of trimmers and guides. Getting the various attachments on and off takes practice but once you get used to it it's easy. The handle material attracts hairs but a Wahl video on youtube explained that wiping with a wet cloth cleans it off very well. The included stand does not hold all the attachments, or at least I was unable to figure out how to get them all in. I threw it out and put everything in a small plastic sandwich container.<br />It has a lot of power and easily handles the basic trimming operations I use it for. The foil shaver is pretty good if you just want to get things looking acceptable but doesn't get nearly as close as a razor and requires multiple passes. But it's better than I expected at this price (check out the cost of a decent dedicated shaver). Overall a great value, no complaints.
