  303. My last Wahl lasted over 7 years before it finally stopped working, and I never did any sort of upkeep for it. I shaved and put it away. That was it. I bought a Remington trimmer after my first Wahl and it broke in about two months... so back to Wahl!<br />This trimmer provides plenty of useful attachments, some of which I'll never use but they seem good enough. This thing has plenty of power to easily cut through a thick beard without issue. The attachments are easy to interchange and simply snap on and off. The trimming guides work great as well.<br />The best part about this trimmer to me is without a doubt the battery. I've owned this for several months now and use it on average two times per week for about 5 minutes each. I didn't charge it when I took it out of the box, and I still haven't charged it to this day! This thing just keeps on going and it's great! I have no doubt that this will last just as long as my original Wahl.
  304. I was too quick to enter a bad review of this trimmer when the battery died, and I apologize to Wahl, Amazon and Amazon customers. I said that they didn't get back to me fast enough so I'd have to buy another trimmer. This is a very good trimmer - long lasting working time, excellent detail capability, lots of blade and comb options, which are easy to change with a flip of the thumb - I highly recommend it. The battery did die after only 6 months of thrice weekly use, but Wahl answered my email within a week, telling me to simply send it in and they'd fix it. I mean heck, they come with a five year guarantee, so they won't want to be seeing them that often!
  305. I used my Wahl lithium ion trimmer for the first time today and I am disappointed to say the least. The first thing that you notice is that the supplied stand is not a charging stand. To charge the trimmer it must be plugged in with the supplied charger which is one more thing that must be stored with this unit. The beard trimmer comb is dificult to attach and to set the beard trimming height(the supplied directions are worthless) and there is nowhere to store the trimmer comb in the supplied stand so it must be left on the trimmer. Then if you want to use the trimmer without the beard comb it must be removed to use the trimmer. The silicone handle on the trimmer gets covered with hair while you trim your beard and the only way to clean it is to put some water on your finger and wipe it off. After one use the chrome plastic trim around the blade is wearing off. The two saving features are the quick charging lithium battery which charges the unit in one hour and the second saving feature is the quick releasing interchangeable trimming heads. All in all due to the overall bad design and poor quality of construction I would not buy this unit again if this one fails.
  306. Cuts just as well as my Andis T clipper but I nicked my face 3X on my first use. The nicks weren't from the blades knives but from the edge of the clipper blade tearing into my neck on tight corner of my face and neck. The edges of the clipper is shaped such that the edge can get caught on neck skin. I think I'm so use to the Andis professional clipper (heavier, noisier, get hot and reliable. I don't bother with the accessories, better off buying a foil and rotary separate for that close face shave.
  307. This is a great trimmer that replaces the several other models I've hated. Much to my surprise, this trimmer works great. I expected a mediocre trimmer, similar to the other brands I've owned, but this is superb. There are four completely different heads with different functions, and a slew of clip-on grooming attachments. OK, the plastic clip-on attachments aren't all good, but a few of them are perfect. To the reviewers who whined about the stand not being a charging stand or the shaver having too much vibration: Boo-hoo. Plug the shaver into the charger to charge, then put it in the stand! Don't people realize that the number one reason why rechargable devices fail so often is because they are plugged into a charger all the time? This shaver keeps its charge for a very very long time, so it does not need to be constantly charged. The separate charger is brilliant solution to making the rechargeable battery last a long time. And to the person who complained about too much vibration: I've had too many units that don't have enough power that are terrible trimmers but they are quiet and smooth. I will gladly put up with a little extra vibration from a great powerful motor.
  308. I buzz my hair at 1/4 inch, and have been tired of tearing through expensive \\"professional\\" clippers every 9 months when the \\"precision hardened blade that is ground, precision lapped, and titanium nitride coated and by leprechauns in a German factory\\" wore out and start tugging my hair out... This set came highly recommended from a friend, so I bought it. I had my doubts when ordering because after all, it's a trimmer, not a clipper. Well, my doubts were completely baseless - this trimmer is a wolf in sheep's clothing with impressive performance. It did not hesitate at all with the clipper attachment and cut through my hair like OJ cut Ronald Goldman.

  312. Its all about horsepower, not sophistication. Like back in the day when it didn't matter what kind of foreign iron you showed up with, you were going to get smoked by a big bore Chevy even if its doors didn't quite shut. Until the first curve.<br />This is a good beard and body trimmer - four star. A wimpy razor - two star, and a confusing amalgam of plastic parts that don't really fit so well together. Made in America, except for the bits that are made in China. Save the box because it is much more helpful than the printed instructions that come in very small print and never really explain what everything is for, how it fits and what it does.<br />When you crank this over it really kicks in with great satisfaction and gives the impression that it will do the job. Given the lithium battery it will probably do so for quite a while and take a quick charge when it runs low. The shaver, however is a small dual foil contraption that I wanted to like because I bought this as a ''All In One Trimmer&#34;. Well, so it may be, but not at the level I want to live with. Seems like it would have been easy to attach a real razor head, but alas this did not happen.<br />I have changed the heads quite a few times and still have trouble with getting them to click into place. Ditto for the combs which cannot be put on the heads until they are in place. So many pieces, so poorly labeled, I still don't know what all of them are for, but wonder would it be so hard to just have one adjustable beard trimmer? Actually, there is one, but it quite is difficult to fit on the head and I found that one of the individual combs is handier. The nose trimmer looks dangerous but works well enough. These guys need to get together with some Italian and Japanese designers and make this basic motor a more versatile and more easily handling &#34;All in One&#34;.
  313. I've owned this trimmer for a number of years. I received it as a gift. I can say without reservation that this is the best trimmer I have ever owned. They are easy to clean (a damp face cloth will get the hair off the handle (for the person who gave it a one star because he had hair on the handle)).   321. Love it. Strong and great battery life.

  326. 3rd time using it and one of the springs breaks inside the blade assemly...I guess I won't shave for a bit and just look like a bum.

  328. I bought this on Amazon about 14 months ago for about $50. I use it without guards to shave my neck and face every 3 or 4 days. Nice, sharp blades (which are ground, not stamped), clean cuts, and overall a great product. But - 14 months later, I can no longer get through my routine on a single charge. This is a huge disappointment and seems uncharacteristic for a Lithium-Ion battery.<br /><br />So here I am shopping Amazon once again for different clippers. But now that it's down to $30 on Prime, that may not be a bad price for a year's worth of use.

  330. Works great, battery life is awesome. It's not too loud, it's hair clippers after all.
  331. This is a piece of crap not comparable to my old trimmer. Too many parts, no decent storage, incnvenient o change heads. My beard is a mess since I got this item. I'm in the market for something better. John
  332. Wow - this little clipper really has the power and holds the charge!! Also pretty loud and a good bit of vibration. I almost dropped it the first time I turned it on because I was so surprised by the noise and vibration. But I've been using it for my buzz cut at least every 10 to 14 days for about 3 months - still on the first charge and it's still going strong. I'm amazed at how long the charge is holding. My last clippers (ConAir) would only work for two clippings before dying. I guess this thing would be called either a large trimmer or small clipper. I've only used the T-blade clipper and foil head shaver. The clipper blade could be larger as it takes quite a while to complete the job. The foil shaver head is small also, but works good for a foil shaver. I've only actually shaved my head a couple of times with it - it worked but took a long time. If you really want it smooth though, you'll still need a blade. The small size makes it good for travel. However, the storage tray is a piece of junk. It's very flimsy, looks more like a packaging tray, and if you touch anything it all falls out. It would be much better if it came with a closing storage case. Biggest complaint - the rubberized covering on the handle, while very comfortable to grip, is like a magnet for the hair clippings. The clippings stick to it like glue and the only way I've found to get them off is to brush and rub it with a dry wash cloth. And it's virtually impossible to get all of the clippings off. Overall, though, I really like this clipper and would recommend it.
  333. First off... People, be aware of \\"Vine Program\\" reviewers. Keep in mind that these people did not pay for the item and did not actively go out and search for the product they now own. I, on the other hand, was actually looking for this here electric \\"clipper\\".<br /><br />One PRO:<br />1- At first I was glad to see that WAHL had finally designed a shaver with a lithium battery because the nickel-cadium battiers in their other units die out way too fast. As it turns out, the battery was the only positive thing about this trimmer. I only needed to charge it fully once and it would last for approx 6 shaves.<br /><br />Many CONS:<br />1- Rubber material covering body of unit grips TOO much. Little pieces of cut hairs will stick to it like glue! Within a week it mine was covered in little hairs. Messy.<br />2- The metal blades rust easily even though they were never exposed to water, only to sweat. I have never had this problem with other Wahl trimmers before.<br />3- This thing is loud when it's new and getts louder as it ages. After 7 months mine stopped cutting well and sounded like a mini chain saw.<br />4- Short life span - 7 months. Only used it 3 times a week, face only, and oiled it once a week.<br /><br />Thank you for your time.<br /><br />*****UPDATE*****<br />Wahl customer service is excellent. If you ever have any problem with their trimmers - use the warranty.<br />Even after warranty, mail the problem piece to them and they will fix or replace at fair cost.<br />I have found Wahl to make the best cutting blades. Don't know what happened with this particular model.<br />I now use the model 9818 with lithium-ion battery and it's very good.<br />Thank you.

  352. I've had this trimmer now for almost a year. Keep in mind I only trim my beard (that's all I use it for) about once or twice a week. It has WAY too many attachments for me - but that's because I use it only as stated above. For the cost, it is great. When I first got it, I didn't have to recharge the battery for greater than 6 months! It's always been powerful enough that it didn't pull my beard. If you read the reviews for items at this price range, this one of the best. You have to make the jump to over $50 to get a better unit imho. I say that having used none of the others - so take it with a grain of salt. But overall, an excellent unit with a five year warranty. The battery works great, charges last a LOOOOOONG time and it recharges quick. Also, if you run out of juice, it recharges quickly. Just plug it in for 5 minutes and do a crossword puzzle. Then come back and do your shave - works great. Then set a timer for an hour or so and leave it plugged in to fully charge. Then you'll have several months of use from it.

  377. Wahl has a good trimmer that just needs some refinements. The good: - Strong motor with excellent battery performance (6 months old). - Cuts fast and the combs work well. - All attachments work as advertised. - The organizer base reduces accessory clutter on the counter top. The bad: - Rubber material covering body of unit grips TOO much. Little pieces of cut hairs will stick to it like glue! Within a week mine was covered in little hairs. - The foil shaving head is great for touching up but too small for daily shaving. So I use my 'regular shaver' for that. - The counter top accessory base does not hold things if/when bumped. - It would be a better haircut tool with an adjustable comb for the widest cutter head. Suggestions for Wahl. - Use a material for the handle that is not sticky. - Deepen the accessory (charging) base. - Provide an adjustable comb for the widest cutter head.
  378. Worked great until 3 weeks after purchase, now it just doesn't work.<br /><br />Maybe mine is faulty, however there is no way to return or exchange it.
  379. Worked well for 10-months of very light duty trimming a goatee and sideburns and being kept clean and oiled up. Today it failed to turn on after being plugged to charge. Took the head off and inspected inside, very clean and the unit looks brand spanking new. Wahl doesn't have good customer service or warranty return service and their web site support is a joke. So it is up to me to deal with the repair.<br /><br />I tested the charger and it is producing a steady 4.30 V. I disassembled the unit by pulling back the rubber cover down and splitting the plastic case open to expose the motor, battery and electronics. There was corrosion and a layer of green on the integrated circuit leads due to ambient moisture in the bathroom. Cleaned it off with vinegar and distilled water and checked the leads and the unit worked again. The internal battery is an industrial a 3.7V 750 mAh 2.3 wh AA Lithium Ion and it was 3.95 V showing a full charge. I will re-solder the weakened and corroded leads and put a waterproof layer of conformal coating on all the exposed leads and chips.<br /><br />I suspect that Wahl knows about ambient moisture damaging and destroying the products and they refuse to cover the electronics with moisture resistant conformal coating used as an inexpensive and standard way in the electronics industry to ensure a steady stream of failures and re-purchases by customers.<br /><br />My advice is open the unit up and waterproof the electronics by covering the leads and chips with a liquid or spray-on conformal coating. If you're not mechanical enough to do that, I suggest go buy another product and hope for the best.
  380. I have been using Wahl clippers to cut my hair for about 15 years now.   385. I'm sure there are many good qualities to this trimmer. It's hard to argue against 1700 strongly positive reviews. And it is certainly powerful as promised. However, it is an absolutely terrible variable length beard trimmer. It comes with 3 fixed length guides, which seem okay, but I didn't use them because 2 were too short and 1 was too long. If you're okay with always using one of these lengths, this trimmer is probably leaps and bounds ahead of any competition. The variable length guide has 6 settings but it's worthless. It's hard to see in the picture, but the guide combs curve toward the trimming blade at the end. This means that the guide will cut your hair at different lengths depending upon what angle you're holding the trimmer. Really poor design. Since your face isn't a flat surface and it's elastic, you are pretty much guaranteed to end up with a patchy beard because the curve of the comb will not successfully keep the blade at a consistent length away from your skin. If you are trying to grow a beard and keep it groomed while it lengthens, or you want the flexibility of multiple lengths....THIS IS NOT THE TRIMMER FOR YOU.
  386. The only problem I have had I'm sure is unique to me. I've already lost some of the smaller parts and have chosen to store the stuff in a small wire basket rather than the nice rack provided

  395. Have had it a couple of months now, and it's ok. It trims reasonably well. I like the lithium ion battery, less frequent charging. More attachments than I need, but I can't complain. The rubber stuff on the grip is annoying... the hair just gets stuck to it and is tough to get off. I don't use any guard to trim my face, and the blades seem to have a sharp spot that occasionally seems to snag or snip at me.. not sure how to explain it, maybe one of the teeth protrudes slightly more or something. The base to hold everything is pretty cheap and doesn't hold all the components very well, but since I don't use the attachments I have them in a baggie in a drawer. Big downside is the lack of water-resistance to the device, which would negate the problem of hair sticking to the rubberized handle. All in all, for $30 I can't complain too much, but I was expecting a little more from Wahl.

  398. I use a trimmer regularly to trim my beard when it starts to get a little too long and have always just kind of excepted that the trim was not that even. The heads are easy to switch out and I really like the fact that the battery doesn't drain when not in use (product claim as I haven't owned it long enough to truly test this out). If you are looking to upgrade your trimmer than don't be afraid to buy this one.
  399. Update: battery still great but once again walh fails to deliver a good product. Thing started rusting after a few months of use. For the second time I am officially done buying wahl products. I used to hate wahl clippers and swore them off two years ago. It just so happens I was at Walmart looking for a pair of clippers I had bought in the past (apparently discontinued) and couldn't find them. Against my will I bought wahl. This thing is awesome and powerful and more importantly for me is that it cuts super close to my scalp because I shave my head. Love these things so far! I will update my post if they turn south like my last pair.
  400. Used it for the first time today. Works great. Use it for beard trimming. I had bought a similar Wahl trimmer recently locally, but it had nickel-cadmium batteries. Took it back immediately and ordered this one. Same price, way superior battery.
  401. Good shaver for the price! I chuckle at the reviews that complain it's too loud. It's an electric shaver what do you want it's not like your shaving with a lawn mower! I've had two of these now and the first one works just fine still but I dropped one of the Clippers in the sink and broke off some teeth on it so I decided to just get a new one all together so now I have a spare I guess!   402. My wife purchased this trimmer for me for my birthday and I have been very pleased so far. The various attachments ensure that you have the appropriate tool for any trimming job you may come across.
  403. I used this shaver every other day for 3 years when one day, it would no longer take a charge. I checked the Wahl website and it had a 5 year warranty. I emailed Wahl and got a quick response telling me to send in the shaver and charger. Wahl stood behind their product and sent a brand new replacement shaver in about 10 days time. But with a new shaver and blade, the 10 days of growth came off in a snap. I love this shaver and all it's attachments. Wahl is pretty good too.
  404. This trimmer is garbage. I was excited to buy a made-in-USA product ... until I used it. Threw it in the garbage at that point, but can describe other deficiencies which I found before throwing it away:<br />1. the various combs just don't fit well and sometimes loosen and come off while trimming (giving you a really crappy, uneven beard until you see what's happened)<br />2. even when things work right, and the parts stay on, you get a pretty uneven trim--especially at the #1 setting. My old Norelco (which died a natural death after years of great service) gave a 100% even trim at any length setting<br /><br />DO NOT BUY this trimmer.
  405. I've had at least a handful of beard/mustache trimmers throughout my adult life and I can truly say the Wahl Lithium Ion is by far the best. I bought it about 8 weeks ago on Amazon.com (right after Christmas because Santa forgot to bring me a new trimmer). I charged it once I received it, used it daily ever since, and it's still going strong on the initial charge. The lithium ion battery is great. I used to have to charge my previous trimmers at least once, sometimes twice, a week. This trimmer is solidly built and comfortable to use. The cutting blades are sharp and never tug on the beard. I strongly recommend the Wahl L/I Trimmer for your personal use or as a gift. (One note though: I have to keep the attachments in a small box next to the trimmer, because my wife and kids kept bumping the holding tray and scattering the assortment all around the sink counter-top.)
  406. Disclaimer: I didn't buy this on Amazon.<br />- Powerful trimmer but needs work.   407. Had this product for just under two years. I shave my head every two weeks. The clippers are cheaply made, but they are light and easily maneuverable. The battery no longer accepts a charge for more than five minutes, so I have to use them for five minutes, then wait 10 minutes for them to recharge. My hair now takes an hour to cut, due to this clip/recharge cycle. Time to move on. It just seems such a waste that \\"made in China\\" products never seem to last more than two years.   408. This is the second Wahl beard trimmer and shaver I've owned. I travel nationally and internationally and only take this as both my trimmer and shaver. It is a great little trimmer and this version is slimmer, more solid and better looking than the previous model. I highly recommend it!

  410. Great little machine. I like the way the different heads are changed. They just snap into place and seat well.
  411. I purchased this item from another store locally. I was sick of buying junk trimmers, so I figured I would pay little and get a quality one. I paid around $40 for this when I bought it, compared to the typical $20 ish that I paid for others (Which outperformed this by a longshot) Well, the trimmer attachment is junk, and not good for detail trimming whatsoever. The length shield or whatever it is called, is even worse. It takes chunks of hair out if you don't hold it just right. The shaver attachment however, is pretty good, kinda. I really only use this thing to trim my goatee and shave my \\"mexistache\\". I use the shaver everyday, and it does ok, as long as I don't actually try to use it on my entire face, because that just isn't happening.<br /><br />After only a few months, the unit would not hold a charge and had to be plugged in all day every day. If left unplugged for more than a couple days, and used only for a combined time of a couple minutes on a FULL charge, it would be dead. As of now, it can be \\"fully charged\\", and it will last only a couple minutes using the trimmer attachment until it is fully dead, rendering it pretty much useless in this aspect.<br /><br />This may be just my bad luck, as I tend to have with electronics, or the fact that I use it lightly every day. Regardless, this thing pretty much sucks. I can't recommend this to anyone, and would actually tell people to stay away.
  412. Pros:<br />Solid-feeling trimmer<br />Well-constructed blades<br />Wide array of attachments<br />Powerful motor<br /><br />Cons:<br />ill-conceived base<br /><br />The WAHL Lithium-Ion All in One Trimmer is a reasonably good all-in-one trimmer. It has quite a strong motor that has no trouble going through very coarse facial hair. Its incredibly long battery life allows it to be taken on a week-long trip without any worry of losing performance. If a longer stint away from home is required, its small wall-wart DC adapter would fit inside of a dopp kit without any trouble.<br /><br />All of the blades included seem very well-constructed. They have very fine teeth that move smoothly. Unlike other inexpensive groomers, these blades are meant to be maintained (a good thing, in my opinion), and come with a small bottle of lubricating oil. Unfortunately, only two of the four blade attachments are truly useful.<br /><br />The standard trimming blade with its four guide attachments handles the majority of trimming needs. It handles beards, sideburns, and *other* areas with comfortable ease. For closer shaves, the dual-foil blade handles the rest with very little irritation. I have very coarse facial hair that usually has to be taken off with a Mach 3 or better blade. The foil shaver (and great torque from the motor) managed to get through nearly all of the facial hair except for a few sensitive neck areas that weren't used to an electric trimmer.<br /><br />The other two blades, the hair trimmer and ear/nose trimmer, saw little use. The nose trimmer is much too large to fit comfortably in a nostril, and - though it has seven guide attachments in total -- there are no guide attachments for use on eyebrows (only a hand-held comb, which is easy to move). I usually leave the hair trimming to a barber, so I don't foresee much use of the hair trimmer.<br /><br />The only truly bad part of the trimmer is the accessory base. It is much larger than the trimmer itself, yet doesn't hold the attachments well. They just sit loosely in the recessed areas, and are easily knocked out when the flimsy base gets knocked around.<br /><br />This is the best trimmer I've used in this price range. I own the Remmington PG-350 (listed on the WAHL All-in-One box as the \\"competition\\") and the WAHL 5570 and this is a better trimmer than both in terms of power and versatility.s, and are easily knocked out when the flimsy base gets knocked around. This is the best trimmer I've used in this price range. I own the Remmington PG-350 (listed on the WAHL All-in-One box as the \\"competition\\") and the WAHL 5570 and this is a better trimmer than both in terms of power and versatility.
  413. This trimmer is very high quality and has made for easy maintenance of my beard. I've only sported a beard for about six months now, so I'm still learning the tricks of the trade, but the previous trimmer I bought couldn't compare. Not only are the blades on the Wahl much higher quality, the various attachments cover all the bases. I still go to the barber every once in a while to get a professional clean-up, but not nearly as often as I used to. I highly recommend it.
  414. As far as trimming goes, it does a fabulous job. This is the perfect tool for those quick in-between barbershop touch-ups, especially around the neck. It's also incredibly useful for touching up brows, nose, and ears.<br /><br />This trimmer from Wahl offers all the trimming capabilities that any man could want. Actually, if I have any complaint, it's that it offers too many different capabilities by having way too many different attachments. I've found that I have to keep the instructions right next to it on the bathroom vanity just to figure out which attachment does which kind of cut and how to connect it, etc. The footprint it leaves on the bathroom vanity is substantial, as well. My space is precious and I would have preferred less attachments and a smaller footprint on my bathroom vanity.<br /><br />I expect to get years of use out of this item and I am only deducting 1 star because I wish the \\"stand\\" were smaller and had less attachments to fool with and I wish it had some sort of cheat sheet on the bottom of the stand for how to use all these attachments. In terms of trimming, I give this 5 stars.

  430. Review for: Wahl 9854-600 Lithium Ion Trimmer<br /><br />Note: Don't get the version of this that doesn't have the lithium battery, it only lasts a very short time. I swapped for this lithium ion one which works great.<br /><br />PROS:<br />------<br /><br />- Fits great in the hand for control.<br />- Perfect for pre-shave cut-down of hairs under the chin and on the neck, makes the actual shave quick and easy.<br />- The lithium battery version lasts plenty long enough between charges.<br />- Made in the U.S.A they say, for those that care about that.<br />- Certainly powerful enough.<br /><br />CONS:<br />------<br /><br />- There is no warning LED/LCD that recharge is needed soon, which is not critical with the lithium ion one of these but seems like a missing feature.<br />- There is no hair vacuum which doesn't matter to me but others might care.<br /><br />NOTE:<br />------<br /><br />- I don't know how well it works on mustache or goatee.

  432. The shaver is great! No question about that one. It cuts close and has very little vibration compared to my other hair clippers. This is a perfect product for bald men like me and it's a perfect travel companion. If you like a close shave, after a few days away from home I'm ready for a shave.<br /><br />My issue is with the decision to include the stand as opposed to a travel bag. The issue is that the holder is not well conceived. There is no cover for it or a travel bag, which would have been the most ideal solution. The included stand is not practical at all. I'd never showcase something like this in my bathroom which relegates it to a drawer or cabinet.<br /><br />While you won't regret this shaver, you will just be a little disappointed that Wahl didn't think the whole package through.

  435. I am surprised by the quality for the $30 I spent. The core unit is strong and solid in the hand. Not too loud, it's got a good torque to it. Seems it would be at home in a professional portable kit. It feels like it could handle most of the same jobs as a full-size plugin unit, and has the benefit of being light and nimble. The attachments, which click off and on easily, are lightly built but seem functional and not about to fall apart. The shaver head is good, it makes a quick and close shave. I haven't had it long so I can't speak for the battery life, but it was fully powered out of the box. The charging system is just a small and light AC adapter with a cable you plug into the unit, not a charging base type setup. You can't just set it on the base, you have to plug the little cable in. Anyway, a good to go little unit, and you can take the little charger with you when you travel. EDIT the attachments get rusty, they are made from cheap metal.
  436. very pleased with the quality and performance of this product. I've been using it for 5 - 6 months now and am satisfied with features and quality. The shaver adapter doesnt trim great but does work fine if ur in a pinch. All other features are great tho.
  437. [3 week Update: I omitted this before, but, I bought this unit primarily to shave my head. (I keep my pate at about \\"stubble level\\" because I prefer that over complete smoothness.) So, I decided to try the Wahl Li-Ion Trimmer as a replacement of my previous, 3 year-old wahl trimmer/shaver, which was beginning to have charging & power issues. And I have to say that, -for this specific purpose- the Wahl Li-Ion doesn't quite \\"cut\\" it. In fact, despite offering a more consistent beard trimming experience, it actually takes more passes over my head to get the hair down to that afore-mentioned stubble. (Go figure.) Apart from this, the rest of my review remains pretty much in tact...]<br /><br />About shipping/handling: I received the unit in only 3 days (ordered Sun.; arrived Wed.) despite my choosing the cheapest (read: \\"free\\") shipping option. Kudos to Amazon for that! (I'm sure it doesn't hurt that I live in Los Angeles.)<br /><br />About the unit: Seems like a good, solid buy. Tested all the service attachments (blades & dual-screen); 3 of the 4 seemed to work as well as any of the 5 or 6 shavers I've had in my adult life (though the dual-screen seems a skosh narrow for its intended purpose). The one attachment that seemed the least useful is the nose-hair trimmer. It just didn't seem functional enough to warrant inclusion in the kit (though I think I understand why it was, given the niche for which this unit was designed).<br /><br />Some have mentioned a qualm with the rubberized handle, noting that hairs seem to \\"eagerly\\" cling to it. Well ...duh. But I see it as more useful than annoying, since the sport of shaving can often involve slippage from the hand! Ergo: rubber is good! (c: (Here, I'll also note that on the front of my unit - where the rubber meets the plastic - the upper edge of the rubber doesn't perfectly align with the bottom edge of the plastic. A VERY minor flaw which would be a ridiculous reason to return it, but, it is what it is.)<br /><br />\\"Vibration\\" issues have also been noted by some as problematic. Here, I wonder about the experience of most folks - as, a good, strong unit is bound to feel & sound like it - especially at this price point! It wasn't a concern for me at all, and so far has only reinforced the initial impression I have of, well ...a \\"good, strong unit.\\"<br /><br />Now for a word of pure praise: Kudos to Wahl for their quickly interchangeable head system. Wowie-zowie but is that ever useful. Once I got the hang of it, those suckers went on & off with panache! (It certainly raises the \\"useful\\" quotient by more than a bit!) I sure hope this feature keeps working for years to come. If so, then, it'll definitely be a winning feature, in my book.<br /><br />The one *potentially* serious concern I have about its design is the Li-Ion battery. I say 'potentially' because, for the most part, I think the battery is a strength(!) I mean, come on ...a full shave after only a quick, 3-minute charge?! Seriously, that's a real benefit, folks. I have yet to test it myself, but, am thinking I may need to, given the fact that (and here's my \\"concern\\") a company representative admitted that the battery's \\"smart-chip\\" -tasked with overcharge prevention- may also prevent any charge at all if the unit is left plugged in for more than 3 hours. (Note to self: unplug after 3 hours!) A tad annoying, but, problem easily solved, nevertheless.<br /><br />So, four stars (or maybe 3.75), due to the few (relatively) minor design flaws detailed above. Ultimately, though, I see this unit as a pretty decent deal - especially given the $32 price (sans shipping).<br /><br />PS: the plastic stand isn't quite as shabby as others have made it out to be. I've found it to be of pretty standard grade. Though, admittedly, it doesn't do the best job of housing all the accessories.some as problematic. Here, I wonder about the experience of most folks - as, a good, strong unit is bound to feel & sound like it - especially at this price point! It wasn't a concern for me at all, and so far has only reinforced the initial impression I have of, well ...a \\"good, strong unit.\\" Now for a word of pure praise: Kudos to Wahl for their quickly interchangeable head system. Wowie-zowie but is that ever useful. Once I got the hang of it, those suckers went on & off with panache! (It certainly raises the \\"useful\\" quotient by more than a bit!) I sure hope this feature keeps working for years to come. If so, then, it'll definitely be a winning feature, in my book. The one *potentially* serious concern I have about its design is the Li-Ion battery. I say 'potentially' because, for the most part, I think the battery is a strength(!) I mean, come on ...a full shave after only a quick, 3-minute charge?! Seriously, that's a real benefit, folks. I have yet to test it myself, but, am thinking I may need to, given the fact that (and here's my \\"concern\\") a company representative admitted that the battery's \\"smart-chip\\" -tasked with overcharge prevention- may also prevent any charge at all if the unit is left plugged in for more than 3 hours. (Note to self: unplug after 3 hours!) A tad annoying, but, problem easily solved, nevertheless. So, four stars (or maybe 3.75), due to the few (relatively) minor design flaws detailed above. Ultimately, though, I see this unit as a pretty decent deal - especially given the $32 price (sans shipping). PS: the plastic stand isn't quite as shabby as others have made it out to be. I've found it to be of pretty standard grade. Though, admittedly, it doesn't do the best job of housing all the accessories.
  438. I don't know what y'all use to trim your facial hair, but Wahl's Lithium Ion Clipper is the best. I've gone through about five different clippers in the last six years or so, and this is by far the best. I've always had the issue of my clipper's battery dying out super quick and eventually losing it's charging capabilities. I bought the Wahl in the first week of June and after about 2-3 uses per week, I have yet to charge it. The charger is still wrapped in the box. The clipper is easy to handle and has a lot of different attachments. I have pretty thick facial hair, and use this clipper to keep my goatee in check. It's perfect. The attachments don't pinch or poke my skin and the blade is sharp, keeping everything nice and even. Another great thing about it is the ability to be able to see where I'm cutting. This thing is no joke! I'll never buy another clipper. The only negative part about the whole set is the lack of a carrying case to put all the accessories, which isn't that big of a deal anyway. As long as it's charged (which it always is) who takes more than maybe two clips? No need to hassle with the charger and 10 accessories.
  439. The only good thing about this device is that it's a Lithium Ion battery (have not opened to confirm that). There is no charge indicator, direction really matters unlike other trimmers I've used. It's probably decent at trimming a long beard to a short one but does not work well for trimming a short beard to stubble which is my 2x a week routine. Essentially it's a small version of hair trimmers for your head, so not easy to follow contours, peels some skin if you go the wrong way, flings hair everywhere. Ended up ordering a new battery for my Norelco 7775x and figuring out how to solder since that device works as I expect (the trimmer attachment) and is waterproof, has a charge indicator and is much easier to clean.

  450. Like the title says, I'm on my second one of these, as the old one finally gave out (battery issue). I got about four years use out of the old one, it had a Ni-MH battery in it, so I guess it's really not a huge surprise.<br /><br />What I like about this new one:<br /><br />+ Same design as the older model, but it has a newly redesigned holding tray which will now hold all of the attachments (though the product packaging displays the old one). The older designed tray never would hold them all, so some wound up sitting in a drawer. As a bonus, now that I have this newer model I have backup attachments since WAHL stayed with the same design *nice*.<br /><br />+ New Li-ion battery -- it seems like it's more powerful than the older version, though both work well. The new battery requires less charging time, and seems like it lasts longer.<br /><br />+ Plenty of attachments -- This is a biggie for me as I use this trimmer to trim all of the parts of the body that have hair on them. I have had some of the other trimmers from other manufacturers and they typically come with the adjustable type of guides, or only a few attachments. I flat out dislike those adjustables for detailed work, and I often forget what setting I need, resulting in having no eyebrows for a week or two *yikes*.<br /><br />+ Well made attachments -- All of the guides are made of a durable, yet not \\"plastic-y hard\\" material. Most of the other manufacturers include those hard plastic guides, which sometimes break (I have broken a few). The blades all seem well made, they seem to be more precise than the others I have used from other makers.<br /><br />+ Soft rubber grip on the handle of the trimmer -- this is fantastic, unlike others I have used, this one does not slip around when using it. On the downside, it does tend to collect hair on the grip when I am using it. No big deal, as a quick wipe down/brush off will get it off, and I MUCH prefer the accuracy of not having it slip around in my hand.<br /><br />Things which I think could be improved:<br /><br />* I would like to get the rotary attachment with this, for the asking price, or just charge me a little more. I would like to have it in the box, but I'm not likely to sit down and actually order that part separately.<br /><br />* The packaging needs to be updated with the new tray design, and somewhere in the packaging or instructions I would think there should be instructions on how to store the guides and other attachments in the tray holder... Not a biggie, as with this one I was able to figure it out, but I can see some people not realizing that the front of the trimmer storage area is for storing a blade/shaver head. The storage is one of the great features, at least in my mind.<br /><br />* Replaceable battery would be nice -- as my old trimmer wasn't what I would refer to as \\"all used up\\". I know I could probably send it to a service center since these come with a 5 year warranty, but that's not something I'm likely to do. I suspect that these use an 18650 Li-ion battery, if that's the case I already have some of those. It would be nice to just pop out the bad one and pop in a replacement vs. buying a whole new trimmer.<br /><br />* Back to the tray, I think the new design is much, much better (Kudos WAHL!). It holds everything this time, but for me it would be nice if the tray had the charging adapter built into the bottom of the trimmer holder. I find it kind of odd to have to guide the wire and plug it in separately.<br /><br />Overall:<br /><br />I really like this trimmer and the attachments that come with it, as can be evidenced by the fact that I bought a second one :) This is a great trimmer for the \\"semi-pro\\" in you, that wants to have that chiseled look, and control body hair all over. It's a versatile tool that is well thought out and lasts a long time in comparison with some of the other products on the market.<br /><br />I highly recommend this trimmer!and.<br /><br />Things which I think could be improved:<br /><br />* I would like to get the rotary attachment with this, for the asking price, or just charge me a little more. I would like to have it in the box, but I'm not likely to sit down and actually order that part separately.<br /><br />* The packaging needs to be updated with the new tray design, and somewhere in the packaging or instructions I would think there should be instructions on how to store the guides and other attachments in the tray holder... Not a biggie, as with this one I was able to figure it out, but I can see some people not realizing that the front of the trimmer storage area is for storing a blade/shaver head. The storage is one of the great features, at least in my mind.<br /><br />* Replaceable battery would be nice -- as my old trimmer wasn't what I would refer to as \\"all used up\\". I know I could probably send it to a service center since these come with a 5 year warranty, but that's not something I'm likely to do. I suspect that these use an 18650 Li-ion battery, if that's the case I already have some of those. It would be nice to just pop out the bad one and pop in a replacement vs. buying a whole new trimmer.<br /><br />* Back to the tray, I think the new design is much, much better (Kudos WAHL!). It holds everything this time, but for me it would be nice if the tray had the charging adapter built into the bottom of the trimmer holder. I find it kind of odd to have to guide the wire and plug it in separately.<br /><br />Overall:<br /><br />I really like this trimmer and the attachments that come with it, as can be evidenced by the fact that I bought a second one :) This is a great trimmer for the \\"semi-pro\\" in you, that wants to have that chiseled look, and control body hair all over. It's a versatile tool that is well thought out and lasts a long time in comparison with some of the other products on the market.<br /><br />I highly recommend this trimmer!
  451. This is a far cry from the clippers I've used in the past. First, i was amazed at the number of attachments included in the set. It can do everything from shaving to standard haircuts to more complex \\"man-scaping.\\" It comes with a neat holder for the rechargeable device and the aforementioned attachments, though I wish it were big enough to keep the instruction book with it.<br /><br />It recharges quickly and cleans easily. The power adapter has a detachable cord so you can focus on the hair and not the trimmer. If you've got a safe spot to sit this set on the counter, you may find yourself doing little grooming tasks that seemed too much hassle to do before. It took me a little time to get the hang of changing the grooming heads, but once you know how to do it, it's literally a snap.<br /><br />I'd particularly recommend this for men with beards or high maintenance haircuts that need to be trimmed every couple of days. It will save you a fortune not to mention all the time it might take to run to a hairdresser or barber, and the cordless possibilities free you up to move away from the mirror. I used it to cut my elderly father's hair, and we went out in the yard so I didn't have to sweep up the hair. No mess in the house, a quick, clean cut, trimmed eyebrows and groomed neck in just a few minutes. What an amazing convenience!
  452. This is one great trimmer, however it's not perfect. It comes with just about all you need to trim, cut, style hair on any part of your body.<br /><br />It's easy to charge (just plug the bottom in) but there is no light that goes on while it charges or goes off when it's fully charged. So you need to time it (directions included).<br /><br />Changing the actual razors/trimmers takes a bit getting used to (or at least it did for me) as it's a out and up technique that you have to get just right. But when you do it's easy.<br /><br />The nose hair trimmer I found to be a bit large and I have to angle it to work right. I don't know if it's due to my having small nostrils or what. But it does cut those nose hairs well and gives a tickle as well!<br /><br />It is loud. Perhaps it's due to my using it in a small bathroom, but don't expect to use it and not have others in rooms around you not knowing you have it on.<br /><br />As some others posted here, there are a lot of parts to it. However that's good as they are clipper attachments for those who shave their hair. Example say you shave your sides with a number 4 and the top with a number 2. Then you have the attachments to use.<br /><br />It would of bee nice for Wahl to include a bag or such to keep everything inside (cord, attachments, etc.). I purchased a small overnight shaving bag and keep everything inside. And yes, it does include a stand but this is my next topic...<br /><br />The stand included, I'd advise anyone who wants to use it to somehow anchor it down with either double sided tape or such. The reason being is the stand that comes with this is way to light to support everything without it falling. I had it all set up nice, used the trimmer and put it back in the stand and BAM....it all fell down and everything went all over the floor. Luckily nothing broke and I found everything. So now I keep it all inside my bag.<br /><br />So the one thing I'd say is Wahl could add some weight to the stand. Otherwise, when you're finished just give the trimmer you're using a good blow of air to get the hair out and you're good!<br /><br />It even comes with a small container of oil to lube up the blades! And the blades well oiled (you'll smell it on your fingers).<br /><br />Otherwise this trimmer does a great job trimming, shaving, etc. any hair on your body.trimmer you're using a good blow of air to get the hair out and you're good! It even comes with a small container of oil to lube up the blades! And the blades well oiled (you'll smell it on your fingers). Otherwise this trimmer does a great job trimming, shaving, etc. any hair on your body.

  464. I've been looking for a go-to trimmer for a few months now, and this is the one. I keep about a 1/2-3/4&#34; beard, and it has to be neatly trimmed for the office. I had also tried a gimmicky one with a vacuum (girlfriend always complaining about tiny hairs in the sink) but that cut even worse.<br /><br />This is a great value for the money and had everything I was looking for.   467. Pros: Li battery makes a HUGE difference. Good strong motor and the charge time is exactly as advertized. It says that it has three hours of battery life which seemed too short at first. However, unlike all other clippers, the Li battery will not discharge unless It's on. So it's three hours of actual use. The precision detailer works great lining up my mustache. The trimmer leaves an even shave with or without the guide comb. I'm a safety blade shaver so I haven't used the foil shaver. Again, the difference with this thing is the battery. It claims more power, and it definitely delivers with a very strong motor. The rubberized grip is a nice feature, even with wet hands. Cons: Really the same cons as most clippers. The base doesn't hold the charging cable down so it's easy to knock the base over if you're not careful - but every clipper I've owned had the same issue. Overall It's the best trimmer I've owned.
  468. Bought it here on Amazon for a very reasonble price and it was shipped really fast, the price could not be beat. Works great on the kids when linning up there hair cuts, battery holds a good charge, not a bad product, would recommend it to anyone who's looking for a cordless trimmer.
  469. I have already 1 month and I am very pleased with the product. There are many accessories that can freely remove unwanted hair from the body.
  470. 60 Day Money Back Guarantee and 5-YEAR LIMITED WARRANTY! I had to say that first because so many negative reviews obviously missed these words on the Operating Instructions that came with the unit, and they also do not appear on the Amazon website. Much grief can be avoided by reading instructions carefully. They also say &#34;Do not use the trimmer while it is charging.&#34; It only takes 1 minute for a Quick Charge to provide 5 minutes' use, they say, or 60 for a full charge.<br /><br />I have owned a Wahl 8900 for a long time, maybe 15 or more years; it was a gift from a professional cosmetologist family member. I was originally planning to replace the battery and blades, but that would have been two-thirds the cost of a new one. While comparing prices on a new replacement I discovered this model. I was already sold on Wahl based on the quality of my first one, but leaped at the opportunity to purchase Lithium-Ion technology based on my 30-years' experience with battery-powered hand tools and the evolution of battery technology in them. Lithium-Ion is the current state of the art for most consumer-level products.<br /><br />I opened the box, read the instructions, and gave the unit its recommended 1 hour charge before first use. I struggled a little to understand the instructions for adjusting the trimming guide, but once I understood it was pleased by its beard-trimming performance. Then a little more effort to understand the instructions for changing heads, but they are literally a snap to change once you get it. I am also pleased with the Detailer head, and thrilled with Dual Shaver!<br /><br />Sure, I've only had my new Trimmer/(Shaver) for one day, but I'm looking forward to 59 more days to be convinced that I'll be happy with this purchase for at least 5 years (as per Guarantee, Warranty, and previous experience). If not, I'll let you know.
  471. I use my trimmer for my goatee and to trim down the hair on my head prior to shaving it. For those uses it gets 5 stars. The foil shaver would probably work well on peach fuzz, on my face it left too much behind. I got a closer shave from a well used safety razor, 3 stars. The wide trimmer and accessories meant for hair trimming I really haven't tried and probably won't. Its that whole billiard ball look I sport. The nose/ear hair trimmer works well as the various combs and rakes for the beard trimmer. They can be a little challenging to set on the power unit but that gets easier with practice. The biggest advancement over older Wahl models is the Li-ion battery! A one hour charge gets me through 2 weeks of use. This includes an every other day beard touch up and a whole head shave. As far as noise and vibration, its a hair trimmer. Its going to make noise and it will vibrate. There is not much way to engineer that out of a hand held device that small. It is in no way uncomfortable to use or difficult to handle because of it. The little organizer really isn't worth much. I kept the box and use it to store and organize my unused and little used accessories. The power unit, narrow trimmer, nose trimmer and two of the beard trimming guides go in a ziplock bag and travel with me. I've owned trimmers from Wahl, Norelco, Remington and Oster. This particular trimmer from Wahl is my all time favorite.
  472. I purchased a Wahl trimmer years ago that I just LOVED! It finally fell apart, but it lasted for at least a decade! Well, I dealt with that for about a year, and then found this Wahl! So excited! Then so dissappointed :( . the unit itself is strong and powerfull, and feels well built, but I have yet to find an attachment I like. Change the angle, change the length. Some people might like this, but I don't. I really don't want to be thinking that much about it. I just want to trim and go. Oh, well.   475. I bought this trimmer because my former trimmer, also a Wahl, no longer held a charge after many years of faithful service. The remaining attachments should be grouped as optional accessories for particular purposes, such as hair cutting, beard and mustache trimming, etc. Hopefully grouping accessories as separate items would also lower the cost.
  476. About the only intuitive thing about this thing is the on-off switch. I bought this to replace a cheaper Remington model on which the guard I use most frequently finally broke. On the positive, the stubble guards on this work work better once you manage to get them on and it seems to cut better -perhaps because it operates at higher RPM, or just that it is new. But that's about the only nice thing I have to say about it. I just about can't stand any other aspect of it.<br /><br />Changing cutting heads is just awful. This stumped me for a good ten minutes of trying before I got frustrated and referred to the directions. Yeah, I know RTFM, but seriously, something this simple shouldn't require it. I'm a very mechanically inclined person who can usually figure just about anything out. It shouldn't be that hard. Then once you DO get the cutting head you want on, the guards are VERY hard to get on and off. The markings to indicate which length each is are very hard to see and aren't very intuitive either - Roman numerals for stubble guards 1 to 111. I wasn't sure the little lines were even indicators at first, until I examined all three in bright daylight. I don't know about you, but I shave in the morning. My eyesight isn't that great first thing. This is where the Remington had an advantage- a single stubble guard that was adjustable, and very clearly marked for each depth setting- with Arabic numbers 1-6.<br /><br />The &#34;charging base&#34; is just plain lame. I had to refer to the instructions just to figure out how to fit everything on it, and even at that, it was a total puzzle. Basically, it is just a place to set the handle after you plug it in. The cord doesn't mount to it, there's just a cut out to allow room for it. And speaking of charging, there is no light or any single indicator to let you know it is charging or is done. The base itself is just useless. If I keep this thing, the parts are going in a drawer and the base is going in the trash. Then again, I may just take advantage of Wahls 60 day money back satisfaction guarantee and return this piece of junk.

  497. I bought the Wahl Lithium Ion All in One Trimmer to replace my corded Wahl hair clipper to keep my hair trim short. I believe a non-lithium version is also sold, sometimes for the same price.<br />There are a few things that could be improved on:<br />- a better organizer for all the accessory pieces<br />- a guide for eye-brow trimming to be used with the nose hair trimmer<br />- pieces of hair stick to the black finish of the trimmer handle and is a hassle to remove.   521. Since my old one gave out I have been sampling trimmers. Disappointed that I can't find any truly great ones.<br /><br />What I liked about this one was the special \\"detail\\" trimming head that was less wide than normal and could help shape a goatee or get into hard to reach places. It also has a ton of different blade heads and specialized guards and combs.<br /><br />What I didn't like, and caused me to return it, was that it's main function for me -- the beard (or in my case goatee trimming) -- was useless because there weren't enough finite settings for the trim comb/guard. At the second closet setting it did did a very messy, uneven trim. At 1 it would make it so thin that it was barely above stubble. It has only 6 settings where most of the dedicated trimmers have at least twice that.

To make matters worse, even when it's plugged in, it won't work unless it's been plugged in for at least 10 or 15 minutes. It's very frustrating, and I'm very displeased with this trimmer. And so it earns my lowest rating for any product I've ever bought on Amazon.<br /><br />*** UPDATE ***<br />I was contacted by a Wahl rep (who read my review) and advised to contact Wahl's customer support, and Wahl resolved the issue to my satisfaction. They will take the product back and send me a replacement model. I chose the Wahl Power Pro corded trimmer as my replacement model, because I didn't have a good experience with the battery version. I notched my review up one star because of the good customer support. [I did have to wait on hold in order to talk with a rep, though, but that's not a big deal for me.] The rep was friendly and helpful.
  550. Beards have grown in popularity and acceptance over the last decade. It is important to remember that having a beard is not a right, but a privilege. Not everyone can have a beard, but if you have been blessed with the genetics to grow one, it is your responsibility to respect and maintain it; thus ensuring many more decades of this glorious time period known as the Beard Renaissance.<br /><br />I expected to give this trimmer 4 stars because I thought it had too many attachments and I appreciate simplicity. I have to say though, I've found many of these attachments very useful and of high quality. It also comes with a small zipper pouch, so I have had no problem keeping track of the accessories. Additionally, this trimmer feels as powerful as any corded/plug-in trimmer I have used. I am very impressed with this product and recommend it to any man who has a beard and/or other trimming needs.<br /><br />Now go forth and make your bearded forefathers proud!

  559. I am happy with my trimmer, it was fairly inexpensive compared to other options and has all the attachments I need. The reviews about hair clippings gathering on the rubber grip are accurate, but the issue is of no real consequence imo. I have only just begun to use these trimmers, so I can not speak to their durability, but I do believe that going with the lithium ion option was the right choice. Battery life plays a large role in user experience with cordless trimmers (you never want to run out of juice halfway through a shave), I do not expect these to disappoint as many NiCad's have in the past.
  560. I really like this Wahl shaver/trimmer. It has more gadget attachments to go with it than you you'll ever use! From my usage of those that I might require, the attachments work well and are rather intuitive in their installation on the trimmer. The trimmer works exceptionally well and holds its charge for quite a while. I didn't measure the time from charge to charge, but it seemed to be quite a bit longer than other rechargeable devices similar to it. The shaver attachment works well, though I prefer a wet razor. The nose/ear hair trimmer also seems to work well. The guides are easy to install and the device is an excellent trimmer between hair cuts and for eyebrows and cleaning up the neck. Two gripes prevent me from giving it 5 stars: 1. The attachments don't securely fit in the base. Heaven forbid that you accidentally bump it as it sits on your vanity - the light weight of it will send the attachments all over the place. 2. There is no indicator on the handset to let you know that it is charging or in need of charging. I would definitely purchase one of these after giving it the trial run, but since I have it now, I can tell you I have already recommended it to friends.

  620. So far I have used it once to trim my thick goatee, using the adjustable guide and it did a great job. The only issue I have is that the guide is not smoothly adjustable. Other people that have bought this complained about the vibration, which I felt was not an issue at all. Switching heads was easy. However, switching guides was not easy. I wind up pulling the head off first before I get the guide off. I used the nose hair detailer once and was quite satisfied. This trimmer replaced my Remington beard trimmer which I've had for well over 20 years. The battery was not holding a charge but I could still use it with the cord. I felt it was time to replace it. I thought the Wahl all in 1 trimmer was a good choice for me since I have plenty of nose and ear hair. It also is powerful enough to handle my thick beard. I think it's worth the money. I would have giveb it 5 stars if I had no complaints.
  621. I've gone through many sets of clippers in the past 20 years and these are actually the BEST I've ever owned, probably by a wide margin. I do wish they came with a 1.5 guard, though.
  622. The best and most powerful I've used I can't say enough about this set compared to others I've used in the past. The razor is always roaring with energy I am impressed with how rarely I have to charge this device. I use it probably once a week to trim my beard have had too charge only once since christmas.

When I started to put it together, I looked for the button that made the trimmer head turn 360 degrees. Whoops! That instruction applied to a different trimmer. After a quick call to Wahl, a very helpful employee (I wish I got his name) explained the differences between the one I got and the one described in the instructions.<br /><br />A second point--not all the parts fit in the stand as shown. The high quality of the plastic moldings for the guards over cheaper models adds to the rating.<br /><br />The trimmer stopped working last year - it simply stopped while he was using it. So he mailed it in for warranty service/replacement. They honored the 5 year limited warranty (longest we've seen, to be sure), and a few weeks later, a working trimmer complete with brand new blades arrived.   655. I had to replace my old Wahl beard trimmer with a non-replaceable Ni-Cad battery that no longer holds a charge. The new Li-Ion is basically the same trimmer I've enjoyed using for years, but with double the power. Other reviewers commented on the beard clipper pulling hairs -- they are so right. The heads are interchangeable with my old unit. The old head on the new base doesn't pull. There is a slight difference in the shape of the clipper blades. Wahl needs to go back to the old design. I can pull each whisker out with tweezers on my own, if that's what I want to do. The noise is all in the clipper head, and is louder than the old one only because it's moving twice as fast.<br />Overall, it's what I expected. Quality, performance, no frills. I DO like the soft case that holds everything in one place -- no one mentioned that yet.

  689. The plastic guides to put over the wide beard trimming blade are cheaply made. I've bent a few of the 'tines' and it is getting difficult to run through my fairly thick haired beard.<br />2. I have found that this is dependant upon the location of the rotating post that drives the blades.<br />4.   697. We've had this trimmer for a little over a year, and the other day one of the little arms of the spring that holds the two blades of the trimmer head broke. I gave her the model number, a description of the failed part, and my address and she said the part will ship out and should arrive in a few days. I can't remember ever having a better customer service experience!<br /><br />As for the trimmer itself, it works great. The battery really does last a long time and charges quickly, the blades cut well, and the attachments all seem to perform as expected.   710. Far more power, smoother, quieter, and lasts longer than my similar (but cheaper) Norelco trimmer. It is not as easy to get into tight places as the Norelco. Such as trimming between your mustache and nose. But, if you carefully tilt it, it works well.<br /><br />The attachments are a little harder to install. Meaning, you must have &#34;proper technique&#34;. If so, it's easy. The plus side, they aren't prone to accidentally coming off as on the Norelco.<br /><br />I would highly recommend this trimmer. My only complaint.   711. I previously used a cheapo Remington beard trimmer that game with five chintsy heads on it. It served me for more than five years, and did a hell of a job trimming back a beard. I don't use this to trim my beard or to use the shaving attachment. I use it without a guard to simulate the effect of shaving, and that is as far as I can review it.<br /><br />Although it can't get quite as close to my face as the Remington did in its prime, it gets close enough to give me a &#34;I shaved 12 hours ago&#34; look, which I find is acceptable in most realities nowadays.   712. This trimmer is powerful and did a good job at trimming. However the blades rusted for no reason at all I only cleaned them with brush and oil.   713. This model is very cheaply made. The on/off switch is extremely flimsy.<br /><br />The main issue, however, is that (at least the unit I got) did not seem to hold the charge for very long. More incredibly, when it ran out of juice and tried to use it by plugging it, it would not run! I had to recharge it for a while first.
  714. I have a short full beard and mustache that I've trimmed with this device for about three months. Based on that experience, I agree with a number of points made in reviews I read here: CONS * The packaging is cheap, and there is no carrying or storage case. The plastic packaging materials can be used to hold the various accessories and parts in a primitive tray (which is what's pictured), but the plastic molding doesn't fit the items particularly well, doesn't secure them at all, and is extremely flimsy. For a product at this price that's designed to be used over several years, perhaps while traveling, the absence of a well-designed case costs half a star from my rating. * It's not obvious at a glance -- or indeed, so far as I can tell, possible at all to tell -- when the trimmer is fully charged. It hasn't caught me yet, but some day I'll guess wrong and run it out of juice. (At which point I can see if the quick-charge feature works as billed; I haven't tried that yet.) Minus one quarter-star for lack of an LED charge indicator. * The documentation is barely adequate. It's not intuitively obvious how some of the accessories can be used, or even which of them correspond to the descriptions in tiny print, with bad diagrams, in the multi-lingual instructions. (What help is it for me if there are also Spanish instructions when the English ones are so poor?) Minus another quarter-star for that. PROS * This sucker trims like a demon. It has ample power, and cuts my beard and mustache hairs without snags or pulls. With very little practice and experimentation, I was achieving perfectly even trims at exactly the lengths I wanted (with different lengths for my beard along my chin and cheeks and for my mustache). * The plastic beard-length guide looks and feels (as you're trying to snap it on) cheesy and insubstantial, but it actually works pretty well. * Trial and error, plus a bit of patience, will overcome the poor instructions. * Battery life, while it must be guessed at, is nevertheless quite good. * The unit is small and light enough that it would be easy and feasible to carry on extended trips (if one had a carrying case). * I don't know if this product would hold up under constant professional use, but it might. And it seems more than adequately well-made to last for many years of normal consumer use. CONCLUSION I always wondered how Patrick Demsey -- Dr. Derek McDreamy on \\"Gray's Anatomy\\" -- always manages to keep what looks like a three-day old shadow, without ever being completely clean-shaven or bearded. One could easily duplicate that look with this tool. Wahl may not be quite as slick in their marketing as other consumer product companies, but their basic product is a good value.
  715. Great Trimmer set. Loved the accessories that came with it. Made a great birthday present.<br />Thank you for the fast delivery.
  716. I have had this since march and i very rarely have to charge it! Once charged it lasts a long time. The heads are easily to change and very easy to clean
  717. Great trimmer with great attachments that are easy to change. Does the whole body manscaping with trimmed chest and legs and closely trimmed &#34;other&#34; areas. Never ran out of charge when using it. It's a good solution for that guy who wants to keep a trimmed look.

  719. I don't know why I waited so long to replace my 20 yr old Wahl trimmer. This thing is light years beyond and solid design and construction. Cuts my super course facial hair like butta and love the barbershop chrome aesthetics. Oh and btw lithium battery is light and lasts forever! Only drawback is lack of a charging status light.

  721. Overall, this is a great unit. I haven't had to charge it yet (it's been a few weeks), the attachments seem to be in good condition, and it works well. The foil shaver attachment could be better, but overall I can't complain too much. For the price, this is a great product. If you're only intending to use it as a trimmer, 5 stars.

  739. About two years ago, I started shaving my head and wearing a close cut beard. In that time I have purchased 3 of these Wahl 9854-600 trimmers. Despite the fact that they are not super durable, I am still happy enough with the product and its price to keep buying a new one each time it wears out.<br /><br />What I like about this trimmer is the compact size, the excellent battery life (and quick recharge time), as well as the large selection of trimmer blades and guards. I like having the wider blade for trimming my head, and the narrower blade for use on my beard. I find that if the blades are oiled regularly, this trimmer cuts very evenly and quickly. If it was just a bit more durable, I would give it a 5-star rating, but for the price I guess you do get what you pay for in terms of longevity.

  742. As a mostly bald man with occasional beards, I needed a trimmer that could keep my facial hair short and occasionally cut my hair. That's exactly what I use this product for, and for the past two years it has worked flawlessly. It still holds a charge like the day it was new, and cuts the same.<br /><br />Before this trimmer, I used the NiCad trimmers and they always died within 6 months. As soon as I saw \\"lithium\\", I bought it immediately. Lithium batteries are much better in this type of application and should outlast the rest of the trimmer. With occasional oiling of the head, this trimmer should give me many more years to come.<br /><br />One last quick note on the battery- I often travel a week or two away from home, and I bring this to trim the hair around my ears as well as my beard sometimes. I don't even bring the charger! The battery is just great!
  743. I read some good and some bad reviews on this trimmer. I trust the name and the price was reasonable so I tuned out the whiners and bought it anyway. I love it.   744. Look, I know that there are probably better trimmers out there, but they can't come close to this price. As a hairy dude, I have used quite a few trimming products over my adult lifetime. This thing is awesome!!! I waited for 8 months to write this review so that I could give it a fair assessment and it did not disappoint.<br /><br />The one main thing that I hate about most trimmers is that the battery dies after 15-30 minutes of use. That's why I asked for this one for Christmas. I knew Wahl made good products, so combining them with Lithium batteries would be great. I used the shaver per the instructions and let the battery run down until it was empty when I first got it. I charged it for 4-6 hours I think, and then started using it whenever I needed to. The next time I charged it was July!!<br /><br />I usually shave with a razor every 4 days, but my razor doesn't get every nook and cranny. So after my shower I will use this to trim my sideburns, nose, ears, and any spots I may have missed. It's great for getting the creases around my nose and everything. The blades have always stayed sharp and don't pull at all. Sometimes I will even go a week without shaving, then use the wide blade to trim down my beard so I can shave. It's awesome and really makes shaving so much easier.<br /><br />I love this product, I've recommended it to all my family and friends, and if it ever dies, I will buy another Wahl.
  745. I've worn a beard since 1981. I spent years using scissors to keep it under control before buying my first electric trimmer. I've used various Wahl's over the years, including corded and cordless types. After the failure of my last one about a year ago I opted for this model. What a difference!<br /><br />This is easily the best trimmer I've ever used. It is light weight, the charge lasts incredibly long (unlike the nicad versions that could only make it through one trim before slooowwwwwiiiiiinnnnnnnggggg). I charge it about once a month and it works great each time.<br /><br />One big difference between the li-on and the nicad version - no slowing down before expiring. It either works or it doesn't. That can be good and bad, especially if it quits in the middle of a trim. The nicad's slowing gave me warning that it was dying.<br /><br />I prefer the Wahl narrow head to the wider head of the other manufacturers. The narrow head, I think, allows better control and access to smaller areas. This particular model comes with attachments to meet just about any need I can think of, including a wider head if the need arises. I don't use most of these attachments, but I do like the attachment approach instead of the adjustable head approach (I've noticed others prefer the latter).<br /><br />I highly recommend this trimmer.

  759. Very capable trimmer, unfortunately these used to last 4 or 5 years. Now they burn out after 1 or 1.5 years. Most recent one lasted 15 months. I take good care of my things, used on average 1.5 times a week, never dropped and I don't travel with it. (speaking of drops, my friend dropped his, be careful little drops will break of the blade tips which can result in cuts if you don't notice.) I'm not sure if this is intentional to keep sales up or if they just started using cheaper parts but they need to get back to quality as that is what the Wahl name used to mean. I have also cut my own hair with their hair clippers since I was 7 years old. So far those are still built to last. I will give this product one last try and then I'm looking for recommendations.
